Reviews.Title: “Great room!”
Reviews.Author: acneball
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights for a workshop at the hotel. The rooms were great and the staff was very nice. My room had two flat-screen TVs, a kitchenette, dining/living area and bathroom in addition to the bedroom. Very spacious for just one person. Very clean as well. My only issue was that the meeting room where we held our workshop was very cold and even after several requests to adjust the room temp, nothing happened. The hotel restaurant catered our meals which was pretty good. One thing to consider is that the hotel isn't in the best area of the city, but it's a 5-min walk to the downtown core, as well as the subway. It's fine during the day but those new to Toronto may not be comfortable walking in the area at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wanna feel important?”
Reviews.Author: wittynamehere
Reviews.Content: Stay at the grand. It is not cheap but the hotel is nice. Good location in downtown Toronto. The staff are good and the rooms spacious. I've never found anything that wasn't pristine and clean here and the gym is nice. Definitely my fave downtown T.O hotel. Thumbs up Grand!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: teach1NYC
Reviews.Content: We had a great room, very comfortable experience. The room had 2 flat screen TVs and an alcove with a pull-out couch, perfect for our 12 year old, who felt like he was in his own room, TV and all. He also enjoyed the spa robes that were in the room. The pool area is beautiful, looks like a Roman bath. The rooftop was an unexpected treat. There were hottubs and a fabulous view of the city. The location was fine, lots of restaurants nearby and shopping. The included breakfast was amazing. We've never seen a hotel buffet breakfast like it. The breakfast area was beautiful, and you could sit inside or out. There was an ample choice of fresh items to choose from. At another hotel, a breakfast like this would easily have been an extra charge, but there was none here. We also were fortunate to get there late August, when the Buskers' Festival was on.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great jakuzi on the roof”
Reviews.Author: Dorit147
Reviews.Content: We also liked the swiming pool , the rooms were very big and comftebel The only thing that we didnt like was the nighberhood , it was scering at nights , meny homless pepole

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: matthew a
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel just last weekend, we stayed for one great night. Our room was gorgeous, very large and comfortable. The bed was probably one the best I've ever slept in and the whole room was perfectly clean. Room came complete with bathrobes an enormous fridge and a full kitchenette. We were within walking distance of everything we wanted to do downtown and noticed there were tons of restaurants, theaters, and attractions close by that we didn't have an opportunity to enjoy. We came back later that evening and spent the night in the hot tubs located on the roof. They were amazing and came complete with a great view of the city as well as a projection screen located on the back wall of the roof top. The pool and other facilities looked great but we once again didn't have time to enjoy them. We woke up to a complimentary newspaper and buffet breakfast which was delicious. I don't have a single complaint about this hotel. The location was great, the price was great, the service was excellent, and the room was above our expectations. We will definitely be staying here on our next trip to Toronto, we were so impressed we almost booked several extra nights during our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for shopping and theatre!”
Reviews.Author: live2travel1775
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my 2 teenage girls and we all loved it. The pool was fantastic and the roof top hot tubs with large movie screen was a hit with the girls. The size of the room with 2 queen beds and kitchenette was excellent. Plenty of room to walk around and lay our suitcases out. I like the fact that it is not carpeted in the rooms...a much cleaner feeling! The location of the hotel at first seems sketchy but it is a very short walk to the Eaton Centre for shopping and to the Canon Theatre for a show. The hotel also has a shuttle bus to take you certain places...great if it is raining out. You may want to take a cab to the theatres in the Entertainment District but it only costs about $10! The bellhops are very helpful. The breakfast is amazing...so much choice! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Hotel is grand!”
Reviews.Author: tripsrus2
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay. We stayed 2 nights and throughly enjoyed it. The hot tubs on the roof with the large screen tv were a fabulous bonus! The room was well appointed with 2 flat screen tvs one in the sitting aread one in the bedroom which made for no complaining about the tv viewing lol. A small kitchen with everything you need was nice to have. The free shuttle service was wonderful. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant which for Toronto was surprising. I would highly recommend The Grand Hotel for anyone staying in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “cityview hot tubs”
Reviews.Author: marsha51
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful stay in Toronto, Canada at The Grand Hotel on Jarvis St. There are two large hot tubs on the rooftop on the 19th floor with a view of beautiful downtown Toronto. There is a lovely 2 story swimming pool indoors with another hot tub...if you don't prefer to freeze in the winter... We tried both and found it very fun! The rooms are very spacious , with two televisions.... We also tried eating at their restaurant, The Citrus and the food was superb!!.... a definite must try.... !!!! We found the service was excellent and friendly and most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: I'm in Toronto every 3 weeks for 4-5 days and let me tell you I'm very happy to have found this place. When I got bumped from my habitual hotel I was sent here and this will be my go-to place in Toronto from now on. The rooms are bigger than most downtown hotels (not that I need more room since I usually am travelling alone...but still...nice to have), the staff was very friendly, but best of all..at least for me, was the indoor pool and the huge (by hotel standards) gym...At first I was taking a cab to my meetings until I realized how close I was.. Our offices are near Dundas square which is only 6 minute walk...Another big plus was the yummy sushi!!! I'm not sure if it's available all the time but it was absolutely delicious...as was the morning breakfast...can't start my day without a healthy portion of bacon (that's where the gym comes as a big bonus...lol! ) Big clean rooms, nice classy decor, great amenities...Great Value!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs at The Grand”
Reviews.Author: Kelly S
Reviews.Content: On first appearance, The Grand seemed like a decent hotel for a colleague and I to stay during a one week business trip to our Toronto office. The staff seemed pleasant and the rooms/amenities were very much up to par. However, during my first nightâ€™s stay, I awoke sometime shortly before dawn with an extreme itching sensation all over my body. Having already had bed bugs once ten years before, I was justifiably paranoid and immediately jumped out of bed. However, still in a sleep-induced daze, when I did not immediately find anything, I resigned to catch another quick hour of sleep before my wake up call. I did not begin to notice any bites until sometime just after breakfast when we were heading to the office. After about a half day of suffering through discomfort, I was forced to step out of meetings to see a doctor. Unbuttoning my shirt, both the doctor and I were shocked to see literally hundreds bites all over my arms and torso. What was worse was that I was suffering a moderate to severe allergic reaction and had large protruding welts all over my body. Following the doctorâ€™s orders, I picked up some antihistamine and garbage bags before catching a cab to The Grand. I went straight up to my room, packed up and threw my suitcase and clothing into a big garbage bag. I went down to the front desk and informed them that I had contracted bed bugs from their room and requested to be moved to another. After trying to convince me that this had never occurred before, they sent me back to my bed bug infested room with a maid who was going to â€œconfirmâ€� based on her qualifications whether or not there were bed bugs present. Equipped with a large can of Raid, the maid led me back up to my room. After showing her some very small blood streaks on the headboard and what looked like the remnants of a bed bug shell, the maid denied that bed bugs could have anything to do with the situation. She then asked to see the bites and, when I showed her, she exclaimed that I was mistaken and that I was only having an allergic reaction. To this I replied that she was correct and that the reaction was to bed bugs as confirmed by my visit to the doctor. Speaking with the supervisor on duty (at this point I still had not spoken with the manager), I was informed that, although bed bugs in their hotel was a very unlikely scenario, they would be happy to move me to the one available suite in the hotel. Upon first glance, the penthouse suite seemed like a nice upgrade and, although I still felt unresolved with the situation, thought that at least the hotel was attempting to make up for it in one way or another. It was only once I had settled in that I had noticed tiny little black specks all over the hardwood floor. Looking at my feet, I was horrified to see dozens of tiny little black flies encrusted in the bottoms of my socks. Looking around the room, I saw what my colleague later claimed as â€œpiles of fliesâ€� littering the entire room. There were hundreds, if not thousands, of tiny dead little black flies all over the suite. I even found some on my bed that were still twitching, evidence that the room had recently been fumigated. However, at this point, I was dead tired and rather than having another ridiculous debate with the staff, I cleared the top blanket of flies off my bed and went to sleep. The next day, I spoke with the on-site supervisor again, explained the new problem and said I was unsatisfied with the service and conditions of the hotel. I politely requested that my medical and dry-cleaning bills be reimbursed even if I was unable to have the charge for my two nightsâ€™ stay waived. To this the supervisor explained that this was not the hotelâ€™s problem and that they would not be reimbursing me, nor would they be waiving the charge for my stay. At the end of the day, I am not a person who complains a lot. If I get served the wrong pizza at a restaurant, I usually just eat it so that it doesnâ€™t go to waste and I donâ€™t make the server feel bad. I also understand that bed bugs (and potentially other infestations) are a rampant problem in major metropolitan cities such as Toronto and can understand the hotelâ€™s reluctance to admit to any history of issues. But, as a customer, I have honestly never been treated so poorly and, the fact that I was forced to incur a number of charges that were no way attributable to negligence on my part, just seems plain old wrong (in addition to the dry-cleaning and doctor bills, I ended up having to discard my luggage, costing me hundreds of dollars). For these reasons, I feel it is important to share my story.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling Grand at the Grand”
Reviews.Author: JohnAqui
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place, The staff are very attentive and will make sure you will not want for anything. The resturant Citrus chef will be sure to delite you with tasty dishes. I had the lamb. We stayed for a whole weekend and talk about being relaxed, woke up, had a hugh breakfast then did a bit of shopping, relaxed after with a swim and massage. The nap came soon after. Out again to dinner, dancing and then a glass of wine in the hot tub on the roof to finsh the day. Thanks you to all the staff, Front desk, Valet and bell boys we had a fantastically wonderfull weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A nice secret...shhhh!”
Reviews.Author: Parttimetraveller072
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in extreme comfort for reasonable dollars, The Grand in Toronto is for you. Great rooms, incredible pools, hot tubs on the roof, fantastic breakfast included...etc. The list is long, but the price is very good. It could be in a better part of town, but it is a quite taxi ride to anywhere. The staff is so nice and will go way out of their normal rotine to assist. Try it and you will see what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing first class hotel *****”
Reviews.Author: AnnieStoneyCreek
Reviews.Content: My boyfirend and I recently went back for a Saturday night trip to Toronto. We have stayed at the Grand Hotel before and this was our fifth time back. We always choose this hotel because of the amazing value and this time they did not dissapoint. We had another couple come with us and we have told them about this hotel many times and they wanted to experience it as well. First of all the hotel is beautiful and very classy with doormen at the front. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms are always so nice.The king size beds were so comfortable and luxurious with the duvet and bedding. Because we have been several times they ugraded us and if you could have seen our faces when we walked in the room- it was the most amazing room I have ever seen with 25 foot high ceilings in the main room and then stairs up to the bedroom.They also left us a really nice welcome gift of shortbread and nuts etc. which was a lovely bonus. The pool in the hotel is saltwater and so beautiful. We spent a lot of time in the pool. There are bathrobes provided and an abundance of towels. You dont ever have to worry there arent enough. We chose the dinner package and I can tell you that the dinner in the Citrus Restaurant was completely First Class- the service, the staff, the presentation and the taste- again 5*****. After dinner the four of us went up to the roof top (outdoors on the 19th floor)overlooking the city and spent time in one of the two hot tubs up there. There is nothing more relaxing than sitting in the hot tub and enjoying the light show of the city that is Toronto. We make sure that we get to this hotel at least once a year and our friends were so impressed with the quality and servie that they are going to make it a yearly trip as well. You can not go wrong in choosing this hotel for your stay in Toronto. If you have any questions feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “True "Grand" Hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: MikeR722
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one week, I believe most rooms are suites, the kitchennete became very convenient for our stay. They are also quite a good size compared to other hotels in Toronto. It is also near Dundas Square which is good. The free shuttle the hotel has in the morning is great, they would take to anywhere downtown for free. Breakfast was also good. I think only down points are its a bit off central toronto (east downtown) - 5min walk to yonge st; and price was a bit high at the time we booked due to high season and last minute booking. If you get a good price stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great mix of luxury, comfort, and convenience”
Reviews.Author: jdavid68
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto for a 4 day conference and was traveling with family. I wanted to stay someplace close to my conference but not in the middle of the rush. I had read reviews that the neighborhood was a bit sketchy. I did find the neighborhood less than desirable but never felt unsafe walking, even alone. I had a two bedroom suite since there were of us traveling. The rooms were a good size. The beds were comfortable and the comforters were quite warm. The living area was a good size for four of us but could have used an extra chair. Housekeeping was very accommodating. When someone was resting in one room, they were very willing to clean the rest of the suite and not bother the person resting. Front desk staff was always friendly and the restaurant staff took great care of my family. My mother walks with a cane and they were always helpful to her, bringing her coffee so that she would not have to get up to the buffet. Extra kudos go to the bellhops/valets. They were always friendly and had a smile for us when we arrived. I asked if they could arrange for a cab to the CN tower for my family while I was at my conference, and they offered to drop them off in the hotel shuttle. I have nothing but great things to say about the staff at the hotel. The workout facilities were larger than most hotels I have been in. The rooftop hot tubs would be great in warmer weather. The views were very nice. The lower level hot tub and salt water pool were a highlight for the mom and aunt. They would spend over an hour every night relaxing. The pool was always warm and most of the time we had the entire place to ourselves except for the occasional new guest coming in to see it. The changing rooms had lockers you could rent for $1. They also had showers and towels as well as a sauna. They facilities were always very clean. The restaurant offered a great breakfast buffet with scrambled eggs, crispy bacon, sausage and potatoes as well as fresh fruit, pastries, assorted juices and cereals. We had dinner at the restaurant one evening and it was delicious. We all loved our dinners and they offered a good selection of wines. WIfi was available for free in the entire hotel and reception was good even in our room way at the end of the hallway and in the pool area. Parking was pricey at $28 a day but you are paying downtown prices. You could self park for less or park in one of the many public lots in the area, but we decided it would be safer and easier for us to valet. Overall, this hotel left a wonderful impression on us and I would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend this great hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Well Appointed, Convenient and Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: riz513ca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hotel & Suites this past September for 5 nights and I was pleased with the package. This was a business trip & conference and I have to say that the hotel did a very nice job of accomodating us. They provided a decent room price and included a very nice continental breakfast in the price. From what I understand, the Grand went above and beyond in negotiating with the committee putting on the conference to come to a price point that would allow the various attendees to come from around the world to partake. The rooms were nicely appointed, modern, comfortable and clean. The Fitness Center was well beyond that of many other hotels I have stayed at and an individual is actually able to enjoy a good workout.The pool and hot tubs offered a soothing respite and the location is walking distance from shopping and entertainment. Another nice little perk is the free wifi. Believe it or not, I tend to sometimes choose my hotels based on this one little item. My rationale? I simply hate being nickel and dimed to death and appreciate it when a hotel finally realizes this :) so I tend to reward them with my business and referral. Something else I took notice of was room service. Room service prices were exactly the same as those in their restaurant. No ridiculous 15% surcharge or other stupidity. I even noticed that when they made their delivery, the server wasn't hoving over me to sign the bill. He simply left it with me and asked that I set it outside with the tray when done. I tipped him more as a result. My only negative comment would be that I felt the hotel menu was overpriced for it's offerings. I will admit, it's definitely good food but feel it did not warrant the prices listed. All in all a comfortable and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: tmc-7
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent the weekend at The Grand Hotel. It is very conveniently located downtown. The room was very clean and attractive. The highlights are the basement pool and the roof-top hot tubs. The view from the roof is stunning and the big screen adjacent to the tubs was a welcome surprise. The service was excellent as was the complementary buffet breakfast. Yes, the neighbourhood is unique, especially with "Occupy Toronto" a few blocks away, but it is very safe and we had no issues walking in the area well after dark. Great location, we would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bas_8
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Toronto where we stayed for a week for a conference. Enjoyed the location and amenities of the hotel. Had problems with our bed the first night and front desk staff was very helpful and willing to get us another room. Rooms are very spacious and clean. Liked the breakfast buffet in the morning, even though some of the staff were pretty rude, taking away plates you were still eating from and rushing you out. The pool was too hot and the sauna didn't get hot at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bad Uglay”
Reviews.Author: SoCalCouple123
Reviews.Content: The good: Theres a heated swimming pool in the basement, a good-size exercise room, good-size hotel rooms, nice hotel staff, internet. The bad: The neighborhood is a little dicey -- lots of homeless people wandering nearby, VERY scuzzy right around the hotel. The ugly: OK, this is going to sound trivial, but it's the little things that make a place good or better than other options. I have high cholesterol so I like to have boiled eggs instead of the powdered junk that the hotel serves at its crummy complimentary breakfast. Places I've stayed recently have been happy to meet this request -- cost of a boiled egg is about ten cents. But this place wants $2 per boiled egg. And, since I usually eat 3, the cost is $6 for 3 lousy boiled eggs. I never knew that it was so expe3nsive to boil eggs and that the incremental cost of dropping another egg in boiled water was so high. You get the idea: the management is keen to suck money out of you at every opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: brunospba
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel ! Great ammenities like an in door swimming pool, an outdoor heated jacuzzi, good breakfast, great view of the city, the room is big and confortable, great beds, great bathroom, good service, free wifi. I really enjoyed. Great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey and Inadequate”
Reviews.Author: Summertime1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend (Oct 15th) for one night....the suites are very nice but the hotel itself could use a lesson in looking after their guests. The focus does not seem to be on keeping their guests happy. Suites are poorly equipped, beds are horrible and our 2nd TV didn't work.... This Hotel Cannot compete with a Marriott or an Embassy suites. They charge 5 star prices for 2 star service!

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, attractive, good value”
Reviews.Author: GertrudeW
Reviews.Content: We found our check in to be quick. The line up appeared significant but we moved forward quickly and additional staff appeared to help but were un-necessary. Check in staff was attentive and efficient. Our room was attractive and spotless. It was generously appointed with an abundance of towels and an etra blanket in the closet. The robes were a nice touch. We really appreciated the attractive dark flooring which was a pleasant change from the usual, often questionable dusty, carpets of most hotels and also that our 9th floor window opened!(just enough for fresh air but NOT a safety concern. I was concerned that there would be sound transfer without carpet but we heard 'nary a peep' from the hallway, perhaps because it is heavily carpeted. The roof top hot tubs were lovely after dark! They wee nice and warm and the jets subtle but soothing. A minor complaint was the TV projected on the wall behind - personally I'd of preferred our quiet conversation or perhaps Jazz. The sound was low but it was an mild annoyance and was almost impossible to see due to the floor light to one side. Do bring towels though, as there are none - or weren't the night we were there and be aware that when you step out of the elevator into a tiny little glass foyer it is quite dark and takes a minute to get your night eyes. We took advantage of the salt water pool the next morning - LOVELY! It was warmer than a public pool, but not oppresive, large enough for a few lengths before breakfast. There was also another hot tub and sadly the jets were lackluster but the water was good and hot. The change room and pool area was generously supplied with towels. The change facilities have an extractor so you can spin your bathing suit and not have to worry about packing a drippy suit. There is a sauna, showers, body soap, and and a hairdryer but you need to bring shampoo with you. The breakfast buffet is well stocked with fresh fruit, juices, cereals, home baking, and yogurt in addition to the serve-yourself hot offerings of eggs, bacon, sausages, and french toast. An international soccer game was quietly on in the corner of the Citrus Lounge where breakfast is served and we watched the florist refresh the flowers that dot the lobby and public areas.The room was very pleasant and although it was busy with people it had a very relaxed vibe to it and lovely windows to the side. The hotel seems to be well staffed with pleasant people who greet you -in the corridors, elevators and throughout the facilities, and are available to help.

Reviews.Title: “Gets My Son's Approval”
Reviews.Author: Temptus1
Reviews.Content: Second time at the Grand, but first time with 13yo son. Upgraded, without asking or cost, to a lovely two floor suite, which was a lovely touch. Enjoyed stopping here the first time and this time, it was just as good. The staff here are always helpful and efficient and that goes a long way to making it a great stay. Complimentary water and internet was a welcome change from our stay in Niagara and my son loved the rooftop hot-tubs and basement pool. The girls in the bar make a mean Gin and Tonic , and very reasonably priced too, although we couldn't get the Blue Jays game on the TV in the bar area! Buffet breakfast is good, although can be crowded during busy times. This is certainly our hotel of choice when stopping in Toronto. However, plans are afoot to build a 46 storey high condo complex across the road......not sure how this will impact on the Grand. Great stop though. Thoroughly enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tobias W
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a very nice experience during our visit to Canada. The hotel is located within 5 minutes walk to the Eaton Centre, which is great for shopping. The rooms are extremely spacious, well cleaned and the free WIFI and breakfast makes the visit convenient. Our room was equipped with two flat screen TV's each with DVD players (in the case you don't want to get out of the hotel). The restaurant in the hotel is good and offers a variety of courses. The very minor negative sides on this hotel that we experienced was that the breakfast didn't offer pancakes and maple sirup (instead they offered french toast and pancake syrup), that the shower was fixed to the wall (not detachable) and that the area next to the hotel (away from Eaton Centre, so you at least don't need to pass it normally) is quite rough.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, large rooms, lousy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: billbennettoz
Reviews.Content: The only complaint I have with this hotel is that the buffet breakfast, which was included in the price of the room, was lousy. Watery scrambled eggs, pay extra for a cappuccino, bacon that died two days ago - apart from that though, a great hotel with terrific service. A short walk to the Eaton Centre and Yonge Street. A good diner/grill/bar across the road. Despite the breakfasts, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelchick05
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay. Lovely entrance, great room. Definitely upscale.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Siennasmom
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the grand a few times in the past but it had been several years since, but it was just as enjoyable as before. The rooms are great and spacious. Breakfast is also very good, and a lot of choices available. location is also good, pretty close to most attractions. The rooftop jacuzzis are amazing, the only flaw is that the have a big screen playing movies and videos but you really can't see anything. Not a big deal cause the view of the city makes up for it. Beds are soft clean and very comfortable. Love this hotel, great price for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: PaulTimothy
Reviews.Content: Tried to order eggs outside of breakfast hours and this was a total no go and the service people were down right rude. Additionally the following night I tried to order crackers and once again was rudelly treated by the staff. Would not recommend...... period.

Reviews.Title: “Searched for hours and SO glad we picked this one!”
Reviews.Author: Alejandro64
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past weekend for our honeymoon and we are sooo glad we chose the grand. The staff was excellent (Celeste in particular), the room was the best room we've stayed in ever and the price was as affordable as one could ask for. We were allowed to bring our dogs (we have two pugs) and everyone of the staff seemed to love breaking role and talking about them/petting them. We were greeted with a really nice personalized letter in regards to our wedding and some very good shortbread cookies, nuts, and other treats, along with a bottle of sparkling wine and all on the house. Everyone was very helpful and the location of the hotel was still pretty close to the eaton center. For the price, I really don't see how there could be a better hotel. We stayed an extra night just because we had the time and the room was cheap enough. We stayed in the king deluxe I believe it was called ( pullout sofa, kitchen, 2 flat screens, and king size bed). The hot tub on the roof was a great touch as well. Overall, we were super stoked about our stay and would recommend it in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: WendelinF
Reviews.Content: We had a longer stay in Toronto and were seeking a downtown hotel where there was lots of room to put bags and a place to relax. We enjoyed the rooftop patio on several days - such an incredible view of the city day or night. As mentioned in other reviews, the staff at the front door or at the reception desk were gracious and knowledgable. We appreciated their guidance. During our stay we were blessed with perfect summer weather, so we enjoyed breakfast on the patio every morning. It was a lovely place to begin the day and the food was fresh and plentiful. With the many dining options in Toronto, we did not dine in the hotel for dinner. The hotel is a short walk from the Eaton Centre and not far from convenient transit. As we were on holiday and enjoying time to walk, we did not use the shuttle that was available. The hotel is beautifully appointed in both rooms and public areas.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed being here....”
Reviews.Author: jenny_lewin
Reviews.Content: We were in Toronto as a family, with our twins aged 3 as my husband was working there for 2 weeks. We stayed at the Westin for a few days hotel was fine but the room was really small for us so we decided to make a change. We were so pleased we did, I'd read some of the poorer reviews and was a little worried however the hotel exceeded our expectations. The room was fine and so much space for a family. Pool inside just lovely and the hot tubs on the roof are gorgeous after a day walking in toronto and the views across the city marvellous. The area for me was great when my husband was walking as I could walk to Sugar Beach with the kids and the Riverdale Farm which was lovely and still very close to walk to the harbour to catch the boat to the island which we did as a family. The island was a terrific day out. The guys on the door and the reception team are nice, if they were all trained on best restaurants and best days out that would be good just in terms of the consistency of the service but they do really try to help and if you ask a couple of them you will find out everything you need to know. They gave us the tip of the spring roll restaurant near Eaton Centre for a meal and even with the kids it was wonderful! The shuttle bus at the hotel (free for rides downtown) was again a great perk and took us one way to the farm and we walked back, again another great few hours for the kids and a lovely area of Toronto. Room Service pretty reasonable and drinks in the bar again really well prices compared with other hotels. Great value and really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Met all our needs.”
Reviews.Author: k n
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here for 3 nights and have no complaints. Staff was friendly and helpful, room (suite with kitchenette) was attractive,clean and had all amenities. We had a harbor view over the city rooftops....what a nice way to wake up, and the city lights at night were beautiful. Comp. breakfast was fresh and had many options and we ate at the restaurant one evening...delicious. Pool is large enough for a vigorous swim and parking right beneath the hotel is easy and convenient although we never needed our car during our stay, as public transportation is available for most everything and walking this fairly flat city is pleasant and a great way to see things. Yes, there are quite a few homeless people on the street but they generally did not acknowledge us and they were not intimidating. Excellent hotel and a city with lots to see and do. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: timh389
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Grand Hotel Toronto for the first time, and was a great experience. Front desk and restaurant staff were very courteous and the room was quite spacious. The breakfast buffet was quite generous, and we also managed to enjoy the gym and roof top hot tubs. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT !!!”
Reviews.Author: nouf90
Reviews.Content: it was enjoyable.the suit was inviting and the balcony had a nice view of the city, the room service was good. and i would love to stay there again :).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: amandastrips
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, nice, good breakfast, nice poool, great roof top patio with 2 hottubs, and big screen for watching TV etc. outside on the roof :) 3 rd time there, will be going for sure, great if you need a hotel downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, pricey but spotless. Front desk staff was brutal”
Reviews.Author: ramblingsalesman
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there 4 times now rooms and rooftop patio are awesome. Little pricey but fun for a weekend getaway. Avoid the parking, its stupid expensive at $40.00 per day when you can park accross the street for $16 bucks. The breakfast is well worth getting up early for, very impressive complimentary spread in the morning. On my last trip the front desk staff was BRUTAL but good on the other 3 occasions that I stayed there. Rude eastern european lady who had a bad attituide and refused to address my concern. Overall a very nice property

Reviews.Title: “Not so much grand but nice hotel none the less”
Reviews.Author: kerr1974
Reviews.Content: When we arrived around 4pm on Saturday (Check-in was at 3pm) they informed us that our hotel suite was still not ready.. That said, we waited about 20 minutes so they can get our room prepared. We were pleased with the space and the cleanliness of the room itself. One of the perks to the room was that they had a small kitchenette with a stove top, microwave and fridge. The rooms to the bedroom and livingroom was partially separated for privacy. The bed itself was very comfortable, especially the pillows - We also got to enjoy the rooftop hottubs overlooking the city - definitely one of the hotels perks for sure - Some of the negatives of the hotel were - I didn't like the waterpressure in the shower.. the toilet itself would sometimes run and the location is in somewhat of a sketchy area.. but it is toronto and your not too far from the eatons center which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Spiders!”
Reviews.Author: Formiga
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 9 nights on business. The amenities were nice, breakfast was good, doormen were really helpful and the shuttle service the hotel offered was amazing. Watch for stains or holes in the bedsheet. I asked to replace my sheets the first night I got in because of blood and other stains. I later found a spider on my bed and disposed of it thinking it was just a fluke. When I went to the window, I ended up killing 5 of them. I called the front desk to ask if they could move me, their first response was to move me to a room with a queen bed, I insisted I get moved to an equivalent room since I already paid for it. They moved me to a couple floors up but I found spiders in the window sills again! Finally, i got moved to a room that got bug sprayed before I went, I only caught two more spiders and didn't see anymore after. Not exactly a bargain for $180/night. I ended up Moving hotels for the rest of my stay. I will be back in Toronto in July and can't wait to find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast was good, service was questionable”
Reviews.Author: kanatafamilyof4
Reviews.Content: We recently went to Toronto to see a show at the Air Canada Centre and stayed with our two daughters, ages 11 and 15 in a junior suite. I had booked online several weeks in advance but two days prior to our arrival I checked online and noted a better deal for an upgraded room. I called the hotel, quoted my reservation and the person I spoke to changed our reservation to the bigger room and better rate. Upon our arrival, I noted as I was signing in that we were registered in our original room. I told the clerk this and she said we don't have any record of this, nor do we have any larger rooms. To her that was the end of story. I argued back that I had called and she finally got the manager, after returning together, they only offered a larger room upgrade but at an additional cost of $50 per night. They basically made me feel that I was misrepresenting the truth about my previous call. Finally with further details from me, they found my call in the system but the person who served me did not make the change. In the end, htey bumped someone else from the suite I had booked. I was happy with the end result but not happy with the feeling that the customer is always correct. The junior suite had a separate room for the king bed but there was no room to move around in it. There was also a double pull out couch. it was comfortable enough for the 4 four of us. The hotel is showing its age from scratches and at times not clean in some areas. The view from the rooftop was amazing but I would caution anyone who goes up with family, after 8pm, it becomes more of a party area. both nights there were groups drinking openly their beer and on the second night there was even smoking in the hot tub on the rooftop. We finally decided it was not appropriate for us to be there. The breakfast was hot and had a good variety. The only thing that we did not like is the servers coming around putting a cheque chit on your table for a tip. The hotel is in an area of town that i would not suggest walking in after dark but for a summer time visit it is great since it is light out past 9. Only 5 minute walk to the Eaton's Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous hotel..”
Reviews.Author: canadianronni
Reviews.Content: Awesome service, beautiful rooms, great patio and hot tubs, hidden little gem in the city.

Reviews.Title: “An Interesting Hotel in an Unusual Location”
Reviews.Author: mykel67
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel by the travel coordinator in charge of the event I was attending. It was chosen primarily for its proximity to the venue of the event. I arrived by taxi and was greeted by a bellman who insisted on assisting me with my one small suitcase. The red carpet on the exterior stairs needs replacing, but otherwise the hotel presents a good first impression. The lobby is small but elegant (decorated in a 1990s take on French opulence), and since no one else was there I was checked in quickly. One of the nicest aspects of the hotel are its hallways (not something usually worth mentioning); they are plush, elegantly lit and furnished-- totally unexpected. The room itself (on the 17th floor) was a junior suite of sorts: walk in to a small living room area with small sofa, table and LCD televsion; pass through a galley kitchenette with wet bar; continue on to a small bedroom with another television, desk and armchair. The floor to ceiling windows afforded terrific views of downtown and Lake Ontario (ask for an odd numbered room for this view). A very small bathroom is directly off the bedroom. In fact, with a good stretch you could almost wash your hands from the bed! Still, there were good toiletry products and a small robe and good quality towels. There was some water damage/rot near the baseboards, however, and the walls could use a repainting due to scuff marks. Because the floors are a laminate ressembling a dark finish wood, they show dirt very easily. It was obvious that housekeeping needed to do a more thorough job near baseboards. Light switches as well were a little grimy, and like the bathroom walls in the bedroom area could use a repainting. The soft goods too (sofa and chairs) could also use updating (not really worn or soiled, just not very attractive). The hot tubs on the roof are a terrific idea, but there were children in them both times I went to investigate, so I took a pass (similar experience with the pool in the lower level). Breakfast the next morning was included. The buffet offered a reasonable selection of fruits, cereals, pastries and some hot items. Cappuccino was an extra $3.50-- very reasonable and of good quality. Service was very good. After checking out I asked the bellman to call me a cab, but instead he offered to take me to the train station in the hotel shuttle. This was an unexpected courtesy, and as it was complimentary I gave him a generous tip. Overall this was a pleasant stay, but I don't think I would return unless I had business in the area. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from the Eaton Centre and 30 minute walk to the Distillery District. Perhaps for others on business or long-stay tourists this would also be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueen2121
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend The Grand hotel to anyone staying in the dowtown Toronto area. The hotel staff is excellent, rooms are mini studios, and onsite restaurant is lovely as well as failry priced. Hotel room has a small living area and kitchen, free WiFi, great lobby bar and daily breakfast was included in the room rate as well.This quiet hotel is within walking distance from great shops, churches, bars, and restaurants. Although I was in Toronto for business I will definately return and stay at the Grand Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice.”
Reviews.Author: mama0105
Reviews.Content: I usually stay elsewhere in Toronto, but couldn't get a good rate at my usual haunt so I stayed here. It's nice. Location isn't great, at least according to my clients. It's a little off the beaten track, but convenient enough for cabs. The room was an efficiency with a kitchenette. it was a little shabby. The bed wasn't the most comfy. The bathroom was fine. The floors were weird, they were all wood and somehow kind of cold. I would have expected carpeting. The food is AMAZING. Room service and the restaurant are great. It was awesome to eat here. It's a good an efficient choice in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Grand.”
Reviews.Author: gsmitty44
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights at the Grand hotel on business. Service was excellent - front desk and restaurant staff were quite courteous. Spacious room and free wifi was a nice touch. I also reccomend using the hotel's gym which has abundant workout equipment. Overall spacious room, great service and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “don t ever book for massage...”
Reviews.Author: adibtohme
Reviews.Content: i was in this hotel last november and i ask to the reception to reserve for me an hour of massage.they told me that they will call me to confirm the time....nobody called me and i didn t have massage...They charge for me the massage hour .it cost me 100doll.they didn t accept to refund arguing that this is an independent massage company....i found that it is not acceptable from 4stars hotel and i will NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL ANYMORE AND DO NOT RECOMMEND IT...

Reviews.Title: “We had a Grand stay!”
Reviews.Author: beachlover325
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Grand Hotel & Suites November 25th and 26th in room 1006. Our room was pretty nice and had small sitting area with flat screen TV and a kitchen area with sink, fridge, small stove-top, microwave and coffee pot, along with plates and utensils. We didn't use the silverware but I did notice there was only one fork, I would think housekeeping should check these each time a new guest checks in but it wasn't a big deal for us since we didn't use the utensils. Each day they gave us complimentary bottles of water which was a nice touch. Our king sized bed was very comfortable and the bedroom area also had a desk, one nightstand and another flat screen TV. There were also DVD players by each of the TV's. The bathroom was a nice size and there were two closets - one with drawers below and another with the safe and a few wire shelves. The facilities were very nice. I used the gym both days and had the place to myself in the mornings. There are men's and women's lockerrooms have lockers, showers and a steam room and sauna. There was an elliptical machine, three treadmills, a step machine, bike and rower, along with a variety of free weights and weight machines. The pool area looked nice although we did not use it. Breakfast is included in the room rate. It was pretty good but lukewarm when we arrived a little after 9:00 AM (breakfast runs 6 AM - 10 AM). There were scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, french toast, potatoes, a fruit bowl (mixed fruit like pineapple, cantelope and honeydew) toast and pastries, cereal, oatmeal packets and yogurt, along with a few juices. We only ate breakfast there once (went to Fran's around the corner the second morning, it was delicious and well worth the wait on a Saturday morning). We ordered room service (they have 24 hour room service) the first night we arrived. It was delivered quickly (about 20 minutes) and was pretty good. We both had the club sandwiches. It's not cheap but you pay for convenience. The location was great for us as we were in town for a concert at Massey Hall, which is just around the corner and up the block. It's only about a five minute walk to Eaton Center and lots of shops and restaurants. We also walked to the St. Lawrence Market, where you can get lots of fresh fruit, meats and prepared items like sandwiches. That was about 10 minutes away. The front desk staff was friendly and they always had two big bowls of green and red apples. I love apples so I thought this was a nice touch. We would recommend this hotel for it's location, comfy rooms, free wi-fi and decent breakfast. Parking isn't cheap but for a downtown hotel wasn't bad at $19/day. Valet parking was $28/day (both prices Canadian). Please message me if you have any questions!

Reviews.Title: “A Terrible Experience staying Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveler148
Reviews.Content: We spoke with the hotel staff over the phone twice before flying in to make sure that the room fit our expectations and met our preferences, which we strongly emphasized before reserving. We then went ahead and booked 3 rooms. The hotel staff promised that our preferences would be fulfilled. Upon arriving, we were greeted by extremely poor service. The bellmen were not available and the the manager on duty at night was puzzled at accommodating us at that time. The rooms that were promised to us were not given. The rooms that were provided did not meet our expectations. He then changed the rooms to a different floor. The bellman left our luggage outside our room and left. The next day when we tried to get a cot put in another extra room that we booked we were first told that it was against regulations. Then another person came and we asked her and she said she could do it but she would need to speak with the the owner. She then told us that she could put the cot into the room but she would charge us extra for the new cot AND for the cot we had been using in our other room. When I asked to speak with the owner she told me the owner was sleeping and I could only talk to her in the morning. We told them that we signed the contract yesterday and that they should have told us about any extra charges in the beginning. I also told them about how the bellman left our luggage in the hallway and she looked at me like she did not believe me and doubted whether or not I was telling the truth. She told me she would check the tape and then tell the manager. Overall this is the worst experience I have ever had at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel & Suites - Not so grand :(”
Reviews.Author: RolyT
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Grand Hotel & Suites in Suite 1818 for one night on 23-24 October 10. On the surface the hotel appeared luxurious, but the reality was very different 1. When we arrived, the HVAC system in our room was causing a loud "squeaking" noise that lasted about 20 minutes. The sound re-occurred every hour or so and was very annoying. I called maintenance, but by the time they arrived the noise had ceased. Of course it returned later, but we had retired for bed and were not keen to have maintenance in our room at that time; 2. Although there were dishes for 4 in the kitchenette, there was cutlery for just 2; 3. There was no telephone book in the room, and the concierge staff were not much help directing us to a "family style' restaurant 4. There is a large tile literally falling off the wall in the shower; 5. There was no bedding on the pull-out couch on which my son was to sleep. In fact, the mattress was still covered in the manufacturers plastic. Nice to know it was new at least. Housekeeping did bring bedding to the room as requested, they simply handed it to us and we had to make the bed ourselves; 6. I gave my AEROPLAN card at check-in, but it was not processed. 7. Lastly, I detailed all of these issues on paper and gave it to the front desk staff on check-out. While they were apologetic, I was never offered any compensation. All this for $280/night :(

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Nice Hotel But Getting Somewhat Tired”
Reviews.Author: Moltrasio
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel for a stay when you have a business meeting within the hotel. It is a bit of a walk to some of the main restaurants and the theatre district. The hotel rooms were nice but starting to show signs of age and wear especially the bathroom that was so worn the floor and shower looked dirty. There were a couple of holes in the bed sheet. The service was great and the food was very good. I didn't have an opportunity to check out the roof top hot tubs or pool. The price was excellent for a downtown Toronto hotel, there is a full breakfast buffet included and free wi-fi and movies in the rooms. So for value in downtown Toronto, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very nice clean hot tubs on roof with a great view, Great breakfast also.”
Reviews.Author: matticher
Reviews.Content: Staff was very helpfull with directions around the city. Location was fine , We had no problems with anyone in the area despite what other people have said in their reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not terribly good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: OnTraveler_8
Reviews.Content: I had a comfortable night here, but did not find it to be good value for the money. I had to call the desk after checkin to have the coffee table and countertop cleaned. There appeared to be sticky dried soda on both. One of the phones did not initially work, and the internet was very spotty. I was there for work and needed the connection, but it came and went almost hourly. The bed was reasonably comfortable, but the room otherwise showed quite a bit of wear. They did have flat panel TVs which were pretty nice. I used their business centre to print a couple of short documents, but otherwise did not use the hotel amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel & Suites, Toronto - starting to show it's age..”
Reviews.Author: AdamSoltsLeedsUK
Reviews.Content: The reception and restaurant areas are first class, however the pool and gym changing areas are begining to look tatty and could do with improving. The pool was a little cold and the hot tub was 'HOT'!! The room was a good size but the couch was begining to be a bit threadbare, the was no door on the freezer compartment. The bed sagged in the middle and the bathroom door didn't close properly. Saying all that though the hotel is well worth the money and is in a good location close to the Eaton Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location - a little tired though”
Reviews.Author: Pippadidoodah
Reviews.Content: We read some negative comments about the hotel location before we stayed, so were prepared for the worst and were pleased when we found the location isn't too bad. It's handy for the Eaton Centre, Dundas Square (tour bus stop) and Yonge St. Yes, if you head East from the hotel, you might see some run down buildings and homeless people begging for money, but that's as bad as it gets. We had a Grand Deluxe Room for 4 nights. It was comfortable, but not as luxurious as suggested by the photos on their website. The bus driver on the Airport Express bus had told us the building used to be the HQ for the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, and the layout of the rooms clearly showed it was not a purpose built hotel. That said, the room we had was quite spacious and being on the 5th floor, had a good view looking North. The fixtures and fittings were starting to look a bit tired, but were functional - apart from the remote controls for the 2 TVs. The bed was comfortable and the room was cleaned well each day. We had the buffet breakfast each morning - good selection of healthy and not so healthy food. We also had an evening meal at Citrus - very good, but very pricey. The pool is a saltwater pool, quite small and a bit cold, but lovely after a hard day shopping. The rooftop jacuzzi was amazing. Fabulous views and great to share a bottle of wine in.

Reviews.Title: “It may have once beed grand!”
Reviews.Author: Berly
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that is in need of a make over. It has great bones and could be "Grand" once again. When we first arrived our checkin experience was not great, could not find the reservation. Once we got to the room the bedroom had a leaky roof and there was a puddle on the floor beside the bed. We were then upgraded to a much larger room, which was nice, but the couch was so old I was afraid to sit on it. Not what you expect to see in a $900.00 a night suite. On a postiive note, the staff was friendly and accomadating and the breakfast was good. We did enjoy the roof top hot tub as well, it offered an amazing view of the city at night. The indoor pool is a nice size as well. I would not recommend this hotel though until they put a little more money into it. At least buy some new couches and give it a paint job.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - little far from sights”
Reviews.Author: bmg617
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a getaway weekend. Had a great time - free parking, underground. Very nice rooms (all suites - king size bed, couch with pullout sofa, 2 high def flat screen tvs, small kitchenette, good view of the city) and great lounge area. Has a bar/restaurant downstairs and you get free breakfast (buffet-style) with white table clothes. Had a very cool area on the roof with 2 hot tubs (we didn't get to use - by the time we tried it was 10 pm on a Saturday night and it was full of teenagers) and a pool area we also did not use. Little far from the sights - we took a taxi everywhere (little pricey) but the taxi drivers knew where they were going and what they were doing. And they were very easy to hail, as there was usually one parked outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay If Staying IN Toronto”
Reviews.Author: taytomtan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days and found the staff very helpful and always greeted us with a smile.. The continental breakfast was a huge plus especially with 3 teenagers a HUGE saving right from the start. Added bonus was the BEAUTIFUL rooftop hot tubs and view of the city below... GREAT for pictures.!!!! The hotel was clean and very welcoming.. We would stay again at this hotel for sure in the near future...

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: flipflopjunkie19
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Grande Hotel with my parents, husband, sister and my son! I had booked the hotel a few months back as we were in Toronto attending a wedding. I had phoned 2 days prior to arrival to see what the protocol was with regards to having an extra adult in the room. At which time, I was told that it would be an extra $30 a night. No problem! I was quoted $238 a night (travel agent rate) for 4 adults. Upon arrival I was advised that due to the extra 3 guests in my room, my rate would now be $319...WHAT? I had booked for 4 adults, so an extra $30 a night does not equal $319 a night. I was mad!! I attempted to move to the Marriott or the Hyatt, but could not get two consecutive nights and we really wanted to stay with the wedding party! So we sucked it up! At the time that I made the booking I also requested a play pen for my 4 month old son. ANd was told at the time of check in that it was in my room. Nope... not there. I made 4 calls to have it delivered and then went out with our friends that evening, only to return to no play pen. However the roll out bed that I had requested was there...big surprise they were charging me $15 a night for that! I called to see what happend and was told that I was calling too late and there was none left. What? I requested in 6 months ago. I know that requests are not guarnteed, but all day they had been telling me that it was on the way up. The next day did not get any better, at 2 pm we had to call and ask if our room was going to get cleaned. They said that they were short staffed, which was no big deal...we did not really need a huge cleaning, but required towels. They said that we would get some soon...we ended up going outside and taking some off the cart when no one showed up. And we had a wedding that we were getting ready for. Got the play today, so that was good! The room had a kitchenette in it, but no dish soap or kettle. When I requested a kettle for sterilizing my sons bottles they told me to use the coffee pot...uck!! I did get a pot from a friend in another room. Last day, we got up and went to the Blue Jays game, returning to our room at 5pm, to find that it still had not been cleaned. Called down and asked if we could get it cleaned...needless to say again not cleaned! We decided to hit the pool, and we could get towels from there, so that we could shower later. Got to the pool, no towels. I called up before we got in the pool and asked if we could get some towels and were told that there were some on the way down. Well, after 30 mins of swimming with a 5 month old...still no towels. So I called up and asked again, advising that we had a cranky 5 months old, and stated that I would come up and get them if need be. I was told that they were coming immediately. About 10 mins later, another man that was in the pool with us phoned up, and there was no answer for about 5 minutes. He called it again, no answer. My mom finally went up there and they told her that there was a girl on her way down with the towels and refused to give one to my mom for my son! Went to left the hotel there was about 50 people in line checking out, so I made it known that my say was less the comfortable and nothing but an incnvience to not only my family but many other people were unsatisfied with the service from the wedding. I made attempts to get my money back for the mis-quote to which they denied and refused to acknowledge that the service was horrible. They told me that at my next stay I would receive Friends/Family rate...are you kidding, I would never stay here again! You are in the service industry...that is your job! I am a travel agent and I would not recommend this hotel to any of my clients! EVER!! I would probably lose my job! I would never stay at this hote

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: mainasb
Reviews.Content: Good location, very near Yonge / Dundas corner (although the hotel vecinity blocks are not very nice). Price is excellent, great breakfast included, in a very nice restaurant area. Many public parking lots nearby, no need to pay for hotel parking (which is more expensive). Nice terrace on the roof. Interior pool has no natural light, but it is still ok. People working at the hotel are very nice. The only thing I didnÂ´t really enjoy was the high amount of door smashing sounds that we heard in the morning from our room. Overall, it was a great experience, though.

Reviews.Title: “5-star amenities without the 5-star price”
Reviews.Author: catsav
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Nicer than it has to be at every turn. Great lobby, fresh flowers, *real* keys, efficient elevators, stylish rooms, comfortable beds, flatscreen TVs, kitchenette in every room, windows that open (fresh air on the 18th floor!), stunning 2-story saltwater pool, sauna, gym, best rooftop hot tubs in toronto, free wifi, incredibly nice free breakfast... it's just fabulous in every way. We loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: markyoshi
Reviews.Content: Times are tough, and many hotels are worse for wear these days. The Grand Hotel might not live up to 4-star standards of yore, but of the "4-star" hotels I've stayed in recently, this was among the best. We had a standard room on the tenth floor. The south facing view of downtown was gorgeous, and although the hotel badly needs its windows cleaned, plenty of natural light filled our room. The room itself was very clean and comfortable, with an honest to goodness king-size bed. The decor was spare and actually somewhat tasteful. The rooftop deck and jacuzzis were open quite late and offered an amazing way to relax after a busy day. The free breakfast buffet was actually worth prying my very non-morning-person butt out of bed for. Certainly above and beyond the typical free hotel breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with a nice location”
Reviews.Author: hellohuzefa07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located downtown toronto and have a very good and comfortable feel. The city center is at stone through distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: janiel
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were very nice .The room was spacious but they only gave us 3 towels each day for 4 people. We booked in for 4 nights. The sheets werenâ€™t changed after 2 nights so I took them off the bed after 2 nights. I never understand why the sheets aren't changed at least every 2nd day. It's not like you get a discount for each additional night you book. The Breakfast is probably one of the Best Breakfasts I've ever had. It was included in our booking. It was well stocked and had plenty to choose from. The hotel is in a great for walking all over the City, 5 minutes to Dundas Square. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great view”
Reviews.Author: gecco7
Reviews.Content: the roof terrace is a great draw - pool, amazing view on downtown Toronto! the room was nice and clean, a little bit old-fashioned. the view from the room was fantastic, however the windows were not that clean. the indoor pool area is very inviting, highly recommended! breakfast offers a good choice. overall recommended, not cheap though.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, comfotable and relaxing....No reason to leave this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LaurenToronto
Reviews.Content: My boyfirend and I stayed with another couple at the Grand Hotel in Toronto this weekend and were extrememly impressed by our entire experience. Located in the heart of downtown Toronto, this hotel gives you absolutely no reason to want to leave and venture out. The purpose of our stay was to celebrate a friends birthday and while we were planning on, at least at one point, leaving the hotel, we realized once we were there that there absolutely no reason to go anywhere. When we checked in, we were all very impressed with the acsthetic look of the lobby....very classy.... with just the perfect amount of comfort to make you feel at home. The staff who helped us were very kind and informative. When arrived in our room, we were shocked by the size and the modern feel. Extremely CLEAN and very beautiful. The highlights of the hotel amenities include a beautiful, reasonably priced fine dining restaurant with unique entrees, delcious cocktails and knowledgable staff. Breakfast is inlcluded....served till 11 (none of this 9am bull) and has every type of possible breakfast item imaginable. Additionally, make sure you bring a bathing suit because not only is there an indoor pool but there is also a roof top patio. YES, ROOF TOP PATIO! This patio easily has one of the best views I have ever seen and has a massive television that can be seen for anywhere, an adorable gazibo to chill in and not 1, not 2 but 3 outdoor jacuzzi's. This was the perfect end to our day/night of eating, relaxing and partying. Lastly, just in case you feel the need to make up for all the drinking and/or eating, there is a work out facility, with changeroom/shower that you can hit up during your stay. I did not make it there but the birthday girl did. Thank you to the Grand Hotel team for being so accomodating. We will see you again shortly for our next visit. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE GRAND!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cocoacrazyny
Reviews.Content: After years of reading reviews from TripAdvisor, I decided to take a minute to write one myself. My husband and I are extremely particular about our hotel accommodations. We never stay anywhere unless I see the room first. Honestly, the hotel does not look like much on the outside but is very beautiful on the inside. The first thing I fell in love with in our room was the hard wood floor. No smelly stained carpet! This was a definite bonus. We stayed one night and also visited the trendy Pantages Hotel and the ultra ritzy Hazelton. I absolutely prefer the Grand Hotel because of the overall package and we checked backed into their hotel for another two nights. However, if we were ever in Toronto again and the Grand was full, I would want to try a night at Pantages. Keep in mind, they only offer a continental breakfast. The Grand is amazingly affordable and half the price of the Hazelton. The Hazelton would be my third choice. Very expensive but fantastic location. The service at the Grand is outstanding, the FULL breakfast was absolutely delicious and I enjoyed listening to house/club music in the restaurant. We noticed many places in Toronto play house music. Love it! The fitness center at the Grand is one of the largest I've seen in any hotel. One of the greatest things about the hotel is the rooftop. It had a very large gazebo, 2 hot tubs and lots of places to sit and eat. Videos are also shown on the wall at night. My husband and I bought some food from Whole Foods and ate it on the roof while watching a movie from his laptop. Make sure you get up there in time to watch the sun go down. Amazing! Like most hotels, you're bound to find something wrong but if you do, do not hesitate to notify the front desk at the Grand. If you're still not satisfied, make sure you notify the Guest Relations Manager, Roberta Ward. She is so friendly and really seems to enjoy her job. I travel light and wanted to ship a fabulous pair of shoes I bought in Toronto, back to the States. Roberta took care of everything for me and FedEx just delivered my shoes while I was typing this review. In case you still haven't figured it out by now, we absolutely LOVED our stay at the Grand. Check it out some time! - Cocoacrazyny

Reviews.Title: “Not recommanded”
Reviews.Author: Yolanda059
Reviews.Content: It was my first time at this hotel and in general the reviews were good that is why I booked it, unfortunately my experience was not good. The valet service is awful, I think they must have only one person to pick up our luggage and bring them to our room, we had to wait 1/2 hour before someone even bother to come and see us and I think it would have take longer if I haven't got to the receptionnist and explained to them that we were in a rush and could someone help us out with our luggage, the answer I had was the valet is now busy with another client, so they need at least 2 not only one, I don't even want to think if several guest arrive at the same time. The room was dirty, hair in the drawers, in the floor, shower didn't work properly and the iron board is a joke you could hardly iron a scarf it is so small. The only good thing was the restaurant service and food was good. It is too bad since the exterior of the hotel is marvellous

Reviews.Title: “Great value, includes buffet breakfast daily, fabulous indoor pool and roof hottubs!”
Reviews.Author: TravelDadEJC
Reviews.Content: Went with wife, two sons age 5 yr and 5 mo for vacation in Toronto. Saw that breakfast was included in price, location was good, so booked it. Rooms are fine. A little dated but clean. The bathrooms could also use a little update, but they were fine to use. The rooms all have a refridgerator and stove, though no pots or pans, not that we were going to cook. However, having plates, forks, cups available was very useful as when sometimes staying in timeshares with full kitchen, one has a hard time going back to regular hotel rooms without these amenities. No ice machine on the floor, but call the front desk and they will arrange to have a bucket of ice sent to your room. Free wireless internet. The location is fine to get to sightseeing destinations. Close to Eaton Center and one of the stops for the doubledecker bus tours, which we used. Drove to Toronto and parked at hotel, which was pricey, but expected for city parking. Indoor pool was nice, looks as seen in hotel pictures. However, the hot tubs on the roof were great. Roof view is fabulous. The breakfast buffet was probably worth the price of the room. Breakfast was included in room price, and the food was very decent if not pretty good. Standard fare, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, french toast, pastries, cereal, coffee, juice, bread, bagel. By the third day, we were a little tired of the food, but hey you ate and then got on your way. Could get a little crowded, but the management seemed pretty on top of things and opened up other dining areas when there was a long line. With all the conveniences, fridge, internet, pools, breakfast, etc, we thought this was a great value and would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “dirty room, dirty bathroom”
Reviews.Author: lynnithj47
Reviews.Content: our toilet overflowed 4 times the first night until we had to be switched to another room. room was not what it looked like on the web site. tv volume did not work well. no batteries in remote for 2nd tv. pull out couch had a 2 inch mattress. very uncomfortable. front entrance should be cleaned a little. very dirty upon entering.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Experience”
Reviews.Author: casinogirl74
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights and although we read a few not so great experiences from others, we decided for the price it wouldn't hurt to check it out. And we were not disappointed! The room was beautiful and location was excellent for us. From the hotel we were able to walk to the CN Tower and Harbour front. We also made our way to China Town and the Eaton Centre from here. The hotel was clean and the service was well above and beyond expections. The staff not only opened our bottles of wine for us when we told them we left our corkscrew back home but they provided us with an ice bucket and filled it with ice which we took up to their rooftop terrace to enjoy while soaking in the hottub taking it the beautiful view of the city lights. Our room was a smoking room, something almost unheard of anymore. The complimentary full buffet breakfasts were wonderful and plentiful. The outdoor terrace was a beautiful place to eat and relax before heading out for the day. The in-room robes were a plus, the pool and hot tubs very clean and the fridge in the room and free bottled water were an added bonus. Parking was only $19/night, much lower than many TO hotels. We came to TO to enjoy the salsa scene at Aleeycatz and 6 Degrees, both of which were amazing and a $17 cab ride away. All in all a great stay, the only complaint being that the hottubs and pool were being clean midday so they were shut down for a while, surprising considering most hotels I am familiar with tend to the pools prior to opening. .

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Customer”
Reviews.Author: Catinvan
Reviews.Content: I've been to The Grand four times now and have enjoyed it every time. The huge breakfast buffet that's included in the price of the room is a great value and open early enough for me (I start work early). Gym was also fine. Rooftop deck and hot tub are amazing. The dinners, whether at the restaurant or part of room service, were always good (although a little much salt!). One time when my room service dinner was quite late being delivered, they gave me the whole meal free. I found the staff always excellent, from the bellhops to the friendly gals at the front desk. Rooms were clean and nicely decorated. I have no complaints at all. Always a pleasure to return to The Grand!

Reviews.Title: “Just Gorgeous!!!”
Reviews.Author: tarrendayle
Reviews.Content: This place is a wonderful find. Our first time in Toronto and we were so pleased to find The Grand Hotel. Such a beautiful place and the staff were excellent. So friendly and helpful. Our room was gorgeous...one of the best if not the best rooms we had all trip. Two easy walk blocks from the Easton Shopping Centre. Breakfast is included in the price and was fabulous. The Jacuzzi was also fabulous too. Highly recommend this place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not "grand" hotel with friendly service and average amenities.”
Reviews.Author: tuckernyc
Reviews.Content: This property is neither gand nor grotty: rather, it's a typical, run-of-the-mill, barely first class hotel with friendly and accommodating service and staff and very average rooms (termed "suites," but in fact a regular bedroom with an out-of-the-way sitting area). Although at the very edge of the downtown area, the hotel is close enough to good restaurants and more interesting parts of town. The staff was unfailingly courteous, always ready to help with problems and questions. The inclusive buffet breakfast was quite good, the gym typically rudimentary, the free in-room wireless internet sometimes erratic, and room service (24 hour) perfectly fine. Decorated in an embarassing faux-luxury style, the Grand is solid, safe choice if the price is right, but not if you are looking for the sort of rarefied deluxe service and accommodations its advertisements say it is.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home, with little luxuries added.”
Reviews.Author: NokiaGirl43
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I have been great fans of the Grand Hotel, Jarvis Street, Toronto. Don't be put off by the location, its close to some fantastic restaurants and shops, also handy for Theatres and the ACC. We had our wedding there in 2006, and the staff were, and still are exceptional. Many of our out of town guests stayed the complete weekend, and were very impressed by the standard displayed by staff at the hotel. We regularly return for stays or just pop in for lunch, dinner or drinks. The restaurant itself offers a good menu and wine list. The staff are well trained, and make fabulous cocktails of a standard usually found in only a few exclusive cocktail bars. I would not be doing you a favour if I did not recommend The Grand Molten Dessert, a particular favourite of ours. The rooms are comfortable and clean. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for short or long stays. The pool and gym are a bonus, and the rooftop hot tub a must for anyone with an eye for a gorgeous skyline! Million thanks to our friendly hotel manager who ensures our every visit is special!

Reviews.Title: “Not so Grand”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler1019
Reviews.Content: Th first room I was checked into had a broken closet rod and the furniture was so old the sofa was bowing in the midde. Other than that the furniture was set up weird. After I asked for another room, I was checked into a two bedroom. This room was a real disaster. The moudling along the kitchen cupboards ws held together with duct tape, hair all over bottom bathroom sink, toilet and shower, dog paw prints covered the floors, bird droppings were all over all the windows, but especially the patio. The patio was entirely covered with bird droppings, beer bottle tops and cigarette butts and th furniture was strewn about. All the electrical access panels in suite had black finger prints all over them. The Guest bedroom had a hole in the door and "red" stains on the carpet. All the carpets ad not been vacuumed in sometime as there was food from the last guests all over the carpet in te livingroom as well as pet hair embedded in the carpet. I could go on and on. I documented all the issues with the front desk and had the housekeeping manager inspect the room. Even though she agreed that there were problems, little was done to correct the issues. That night I invited guests to join me in their restaurant for dinner and we all ended up with food poisoning the next day. Since I wa sick the remainder of my trip, I was not able to change hotels. During check out I wanted to speak with a manager and I was told everyone was in "All day meetings". This was on February 12, 2010. Everyday since, I have called to get a resolution to these problems and they have been in the same meetings. I was just told by them that they would do nothing to compensate for my inconvenience. All I asked for was a slight reduction in rate. I was told they would give me an attractive rate my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KennyEngland079
Reviews.Content: I came here on business so the hotel was booked for me. I had no choice in where I came. I came on here and read reviews as a matter of interest and what i read did not fill me with confidence. Tales of unhelpful staff, poor internet connection, not able to use the facilities, the pool being dirty.
