But the reason i have taken the unusual step of coming on here and writing a review is that this could not be further from the truth. the staff are very helpful, the hotel is excellent. the facilities are first class (you HAVE To try the rooftop hot tub with big screen TV projected on a massive screen and views over the city). OVerall this has been a fantastic stay and the hotel has been a great place to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel for a great rate”
Reviews.Author: LolaRamona
Reviews.Content: I can't understand these bad reviews. We have stayed there 3 times in the last year, and we live in the city! This is one of the best deals in town, it's not only at least $10-40 less than most downtown hotels. it includes a lovely buffet breakfast in a wonderful restaurant. The service was great and our rooms have always been extremely clean, comfortable and perfect. The pool is gorgeous, one of the best I've seen, the rooftop jaccuzi is amazing, with one of the best views of the city, and the gym is excellent. You get a free paper delivered to your door in the morning. Bathrobes, free 'adult' movies (if you're into that), two tv's, a kitchen area, living room and very comfortable bed. Nothing seems like an 'added cost' and the conseirge will even get a taxi for you. We have absolutely nothing but rave reviews for this place, and we stay in many hotels. I don't know what more you could want for $160 a night in downtown T.O but I can tell you that's as great as it can get. Our check-in girls have always been friendly and helpful, though I've noticed people having issues with their credit cards not having enough room on them to check in, perhaps that's why some have been annoyed? The place is great, we'd love to rent a place there for a week or more, it's a great get away, and if people want to pay double to stay somewhere else with nothing more to be offered, then that leaves this place open for those of us who know a great deal when we find it! The Grand is gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Foiled again at the Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SupersonicGypsy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to celebrate our anniversary in their "Jacuzzi Suite" in December. I had read reviews saying that people who had booked that room had had bad luck with it being "out of service" when they showed up but we booked anyway and crossed our fingers. When we arrived we were told (womp womp) that the room was out of service...they tried to upgrade us to the Ambassador Suite, which we took a look at, but decided that it was basically an apartment...if we wanted that we would've stayed home. They were very good about refunding us and sending us on our way, and the hotel we stayed in (Radisson on Derry Rd in Mississauga) was AMAAAAAZING with a humungous 6 foot round jacuzzi and a fireplace in the room!! So not all was lost, but we're also very positive people who live in the city.....I can't imagine travelling all the way to Toronto to hear that.

Reviews.Title: “Overated and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: eightfoldpath
Reviews.Content: Booked a stay here after hearing all the 'hype' about the terrific amenities. Pulled up to valet parking and there was not only no valet but also no bellhop available; had to climb stairs and trek all the way to front desk to find this out. They did round up a maintenance man to help us with our luggage and told us to leave our car until someone could park it. This treatment upon arrival was the first clue that the Grand Hotel was more 'show' than anything. Visually stunning no doubt, the indoor pool and rooftop terrace with hot tubs as well as room decor were all pleasing to the eye. The pool was salt water but over-heated so as not to be at all refreshing. Smokers were having a field day on the roof top, including smoking (and not just cigarettes) in the hot tubs; doesn't lend itself to clean conditions in the water or while you are barefoot on the decktop. Our room was just plain dirty; look closely at the walls and baseboards especially in the bathrooms and the lack of thorough cleaning was all too evident. Our bathtub featured a showerhead that was like a roulette wheel; three directional jets with waterpressure so low that only one would actually shoot out any water at a time. I have long hair and it took 20 minutes to wash and condition it as rinsing was a (--). Room boasts free WIFI for the business traveller however, after about 20 minutes of pure frustration trying to connect, I called the front desk only to be told that the further your room is from the router the less the chance you can connect. They let me put a $15 deposit on a cable and use it to connect my laptop stationary style via a room outlet. The complimentary breakfast was excellent, nice restaurant with quick and easy service to get you fed in the mornings. When it was time to check out we learned that the bellman is also the valet and the shuttle driver; we could either wait 20mins for him to return, or we could hump our own luggage and retrieve our own car. Seeing as we paid $28 a day for the "convenience" (lol) of valet, we decided to wait. The final 'nail' in this hoteI's 'coffin' if you are travelling by car is the location, add an extra 30 minutes to access any major route from here due to traffic snarls that just don't quit! I am an extensive business traveller and stay in downtown Toronto over 25 nights per year; I would not stay at the Grand Hotel again. Proves to me once again that when it sounds too good to be true it usually is.

Reviews.Title: “Check out the roof!”
Reviews.Author: dayyytrippper
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a little weekend away with my girlfriend. She, like another reviewer, made reservations for the Jacuzzi suite only to be told on check it that it was unavailable. The staff offered to upgrade the room immediately which was nice but it having a reservation placed a month in advance we expected maybe a bit of notice. Oh well, we got over it. Our replacement room was very spacious, with a kitchen area, living/dining room, second floor loft bedroom overlooking the main room, 2 bathrooms and a terrace. The bed was very comfortable. On a very unusual note we discovered a piece of metal, looked to be a bed spring coil, between the sheets, weird. All in all we were satisfied with the room. The location is great if you're looking to do some shopping, steps away from the Eaton's Centre. One downside to the location was that this particular suite was on the third floor and unfortunately there can be lots of traffic or emergency crews so it was somewhat noisy at night. The best part of the hotel is definitely the roof top hot tub, great views of the city and very relaxing. All in all we had a good stay at the Grand. Just beware about the Jacuzzi suite if you're planning something special.

Reviews.Title: “Worst custmor service ever faced”
Reviews.Author: Cleopatracchi
Reviews.Content: Although it looks beautiful hotel, we had to meet the worst customer service ever through all over the world!!!!! My friend came over from Japan could not stay this hotel with some problem of booking. I suppose the real value turns up when something happens, however, I would have to say nobody from receptionist to the general manager does respectable behavior. I hope you do not meet those troubles.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurie3950
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. The rooms are large and airy, the beds super comfy and so clean. The pool area and hot tubs on the roof top are amazing, you can see all of downtown and it is beautiful. Reading the reviews of the surrounding area made me wary but I didn't see or encounter anything that made me the least little bit anxious. We walked from the Rogers Centre back to the hotel after the concert we attended without issue. The only problem I had with the location is how far it is from the Rogers centre/ACC/CN Tower as the shuttle stops running in the late afternoon. The buffet in the morning was nice with hot and cold food. Enjoyed the fresh fruit and the coffee was great. The service is excellent and for what we paid it felt like a five star experience on a three star budget.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for downtown Toronto - exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: jangale
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband when he had a 2 day conference right here at the hotel. I figured with the company paying I'd spend 2 days in Toronto. I normally would say the price was higher than I would like to pay, but the continental breakfast is included. It was in their restaurant (bistro atmosphere), and several hot dishes. Along with cereal, instant oatmeal, toast & bagel, they had croissants and danishes. (Not a greasy cake donut in sight, thank God!) They also had 4 juices, yogurts and a huge bowl of fruit salad . The room was really spacious with a living area and 2 dvd players (apparently you could rent movies from the gift shop) and 2 tvs. There was also a fridge, microwave and a 2 burner stove. I didn't see any cooking utensils so I don't know if they had pots or anything. There was a small coffee maker with tea bags & coffee and 2 plates & mugs. It would be ideal for travellers to heat frozen dinners etc to cut down on costs. I think there is a Sobeys or Loblaws a couple of blocks away. If we had stayed longer (or my hubby wasn't on expenses) we would have brought more food. Walking distance to subway, Eaton Centre, Queens Park and the complimentary shuttle would take you anywhere in the downtown area. He took us to the CN tower. Night time isn't the most pleasant (what downtown of any city is?) but we just walked with purpose and didn't stay out late. As long as you know where you are and how to get there, you will be fine. Choice of restaurants nearby but we just went to Mr Greenjeans in the Eaton Centre, for old times sake. We weren't able to check out the pool or jacuzzi - didn't think of it, but I would definitely stay here again and bring my bathing suit! Hubby said it was good for the conference, food was good and staff was attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Grand in every sense of the word.”
Reviews.Author: FrancesFC
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for a business trip for 2 nights. Why did I book it? There facilities - the pool and exercise room looked lovely as did the price of the suites. I am sorry, but a junior suite in toronto for 219.00 can. including breakfast!! that is amazing. The only bad thing was that I wish I had had someone to share this fabulous room with. The junior suite, ask for room 1218, is massive! You walk in and immediately have a nice bathroom, tastefull, beautiful, lots of cupboard space. Straight ahead is a lounge, couch, TV, Desk, Coffee table, hang a left and there is a fully functional trendy kitchen :) and wait for it... more... a breakfast nook with yet another television. The bedroom, again another television with a very very comfortable bed. Basically this exceeded expectations room-wise. But the neo-classical decor in the hotel in general is stunning and something hard to attain - tasteful :) Check out their website, the pool is gorgeous and actually is exactly like the photos!! That never happens. The rooftop patio has two hottubs with a fabulous view of toronto. Hands down, the staff are polite and friendly, helpful, the breakfast is good, the rooms are outstanding and the location is so convenient. The Grand hotel - a very good alternative to the usual suspects - delta, hilton, sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel....”
Reviews.Author: kdufour
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Our deluxe room was huge and had the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Great Service..Everyone is very friendly and talks to you. This hotel offered a hot buffet breakfast -free of charge. The roof top is great and very romantic.. My Boyfriend asked me to marry him on the roof top which was so romantic and perfect. The car parking is safe and not expensive compared to other hotels...$19.00 per night with in and out access. Cannot say that anything was wrong with this hotel...You even have complimentary shuttle to the surroundings. Thanks Grand Hotel for the perfect stay!!

Reviews.Title: “best value for your dollar”
Reviews.Author: dexdgolden
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Grand for two nights - the day prior to and the day after our wedding. The de luxe room that we got was nice - it had a living room area for guests to sit and watch tv, we had a small fridge and kitchenette and the bedroom itself was spacious enough (plus, it had another flat screen tv). The hotel offers free wifi internet service. I brought my netbook and tapped into their wifi service. It was not strong, but functional for basic browsing. The hotel offers continental breakfast buffet at their restaurant at the lobby. The selection is not varied, but at least, you can toast your own bread or bagel. Service was great and the lady that did our manicure/pedicure was friendly and accommodating. The "spa" is just a tiny room inside the gym located on the 2nd floor. We expected more of a high-end clientelle, but was surprised to see many teen-agers. I guess that goes to show that the rooms at the hotel are very affordable. The location is perfect because it is within walking distance to bloor (10 mins) and downtown (20 mins). There is a newly opened Thai restaurant beside the hotel if you feel like dining out, it is the place to go. 'Just remember that because it is within the dundas/sherbourne zone, you will find many homeless people roaming the streets. Try not to walk by yourself come sun down. The next time we stay here, we would check out the rooftop pool and jacuzzi. We didn't have the chance to visit the roof top because of the limited time of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in town”
Reviews.Author: Kat&Cue
Reviews.Content: We went to Toronto to go to a baseball game and to sightsee. We picked the Grand from the many to choose from in a Travelocity package deal from Minneapolis. We picked the right place. The staff were friendly and helpful. The daily complimentary breakfast was fantastic. There is a beautiful hot tub on the roof, 19 floors high. The city and Lake Ontario are yours to see from each direction. At night there is a big screen (drive in movie size) on the roof. They had VH1 on, and that was my least favorite thing. The hotel is on the 505 streetcar line and a quick walk to Yonge-Dundas (the "Times Square" of Toronto.) They also accommodated us with a smoking room, and although I know this is not politically correct, it sure is nice if you're a smoker. There is a full kitchen and 2 flat screen tv's in the room. Nice size room.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location for stay in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: OrganicMama
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Toronto, and we stayed 5 nights at the Grand from August 28 to Sept. 2. As a family of five, the suite arrangements, kitchenette, and free breakfasts worked out well for our family. The Grand is a wonderful, classic old hotel--we loved the decor and elegant environment. It is not in a great area...so it's not best for people who are not comfortable in an urban environment. We never felt in danger, though, and we walked to Eaton Centre a few times and up to Cabbagetown and back. We had a great view out of the city and the lake out of our window (on the 15th floor). The rooftop jacuzzis are great! Don't miss them. The only weird thing about that is that they show TV on a screen late at night...which somewhat spoils the romantic environment! (We were there with our three kids, so this didn't apply to us--but if we had been there on a romantic getaway, this would have annoyed us...) The only thing we weren't crazy about was the high parking rate...but I suppose that's normal for Toronto hotels. We went to the Ontario Science Centre, Casa Roma, Centreville in the Toronto Islands, and Cabbagetown, and Riverdale Park. The last night we had a great dinner at the Pickle Barrel in the Eaton Centre--fun! The hotel pool was FANTASTIC--we loved it! The jacuzzi in the basement was out of service during the last few days we were there, but the ones on the rooftop were working! The Canadian-American exchange rate was not very favorable when we visited, so the hotel was not as affordable as we initially thought. But overall, we had a great stay in Toronto, and the hotel was a perfect launching pad for our adventures!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Felt very luxurious to us!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_teacher23
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay for 4 nights here! We got a deal through Expedia which meant we could stay for longer than had we afforded normal rates. Loved it! The doormen were very helpful, desk staff very cheery and helped us book a car (cheaply) to the airport managing to secure us a stretch limo!!! The room was lovely, overlooking the streets and on floor 18 (one floor lower than the rooftop jacuzzi) Breakfast was included and a huge selection of cooked, pastries, coffee, tea - you name it, you could have it - REALLY REALLY good! Back to the rooftop jacuzzi - not only did it have an amazing view in the day, it also had an awesome view at night of all the lights and CN tower. You can go up there in the plush bathrobes provided and watch TV on the massive screen whilst sitting in there. Now if that isn't luxury then I've got it wrong - we loved it! The beds were comfy, rooms well appointed. There's an indoor swimming pool, exercise rooms, you name it, they have it and not overpriced either. We were only a short 10 min walk to Younge Square and Toronto subway isn't as easy as other cities, but we had no problems getting around and taxis are cheap too. I'm already trying to work out when we can go back.!!

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with the service - beds are not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: Mkwra
Reviews.Content: A word of warning about this hotel. If you book a king-sized bed as advertised on hotels.com and which you will pay a higher rate for you may be bitterly disappointed. We did exactly that, ignoring the Hilton across the road, because we thought the Grand looked nicer, and when we got to our suite we found what was effectively a English sized double bed. When we took it up with the reception staff we were told that on our booking it said that they couldnâ€™t guarantee the preferences that people choose. Hold on a minute we paid extra for a king-sized bed! No we were told we had paid extra for the junior suite and the king sized bed was a preference not part of the booking. Also, we were told that some of the junior suites actually have queen sized beds, and even that other guests have previously complained about the king size beds not being that big. Anyway, we looked up our booking on the free internet computer available in the lobby (a nice feature which hadnâ€™t been available in many of the other hotels we stayed in, in Canada) and there was no mention of the hotel not being able to guarantee the king size bed. We had stayed in 7 hotels during our trip and paid extra for king size and in every other hotel got a king size bed. Why does the Grand think it can be different? We were given all sorts of excuses by the reception staff who frankly came across as patronising and to be honest I think they thought we were a lower class of customer because we had booked online and paid less money for the room. Effectively the hotel is mis-advertising its rooms on hotels.com. We were even told that it was Expediaâ€™s fault for wrongly guaranteeing the bed! But it is the Grand thatâ€™s puts the information up there. These beds are double beds and they shouldnâ€™t be charging extra for them and advertising them as kings. In the end we were told that the manager wasnâ€™t in until Monday (that old one) and that the staff who were there (who were supervisors) had no authority to do anything about the issue. Basically they werenâ€™t prepared to deal with our complaint â€“ NOT GOOD SERVICE. They were effectively saying that we were wrong and they didnâ€™t even at any stage say they were sorry. Nothing was offered to us to compensate for the problem. Iâ€™m not in the service industry but I donâ€™t think this represents good service. We actually felt scared about approaching the reception staff about other matters after this â€“ not a good feeling! It took us about an hour backwards and forwards checking the internet, speaking to 2 of the receptionists etc etc. In the end we took the names of the 2 members of staff and said we would be explaining all this in a report to their manager and would be quoting their names. Amazingly within about 60 seconds the phone rang and they explained that they had had a cancellation and that one of the king sized beds was now available!!!! And by the way the view from this room was much nicer â€“ towards downtown as advertised on the hotel website and not overlooking the lap-dancing club on the other side of the block. However, the bed in the room still didnâ€™t look like a king sized bed to us although it was much bigger than the other room. Overall, I would like to say that the hotel is really lovely, very clean and some amazing features such as the swimming pool, the reception area and the Jacuzzis on the top floor with a cinema screen and views of the city (I kid you not!). However, we were really not happy about having to complain and not being dealt with appropriately. Other points about the hotel are that it borders on a really dodgy neighbourhood one side however, it is just a stoneâ€™s throw from Yonge-Dundas square which is a great place to visit. The bathrooms in our suites were very small but you do get a kitchenette with fridge etc so you can buy goodies from local stores. The breakfast was one of the best we got in Canada and included in the price but, the breakfast area wasnâ€™t really big enough for the number of residents so quite chaotic. So a mixed bag really.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for our Trip”
Reviews.Author: happytrails2uall
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the 2009 Buskerfest and we were happy to be able to walk down to the fest every day. Others have remarked on the The Grands location which is a couple blocks down from a Salvation Army Residence, (so what, that's reality.) Overall we had a great time. The service at the Grand was good and the free buffet breakfast was more than expected. Our room was modern, bed was comfortable and we appreciated the( 2) flat screen TV's, lighting, and kitchenette. The indoor pool looked great, the water was warm. The view from the roof top was fantastic. There were 2 small hot tubs, a gazebo and a film projected on a big screen at night....OK the projector quality wasnt that great but we appreciated the effort. Was the price that we paid at the Grand worth it? For us, Yes.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand is A Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kenycar
Reviews.Content: We booked a weekend getaway and decided to stay at the Grand. Our room was very clean and nicely appointed with a very friendly staff. The hotel is coveniently located to the Eaton Center and they have a minvan that will take you to any tourist destination. We were given a ride to the CN Tower. The Hotel is a short walk to other forms of transportation, and there are several convenience stores located close by. The buffet breakfast which was included in our booking was the best we ever had. We will definatley stay again next time we're in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: sophieCumbria
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the grand for 4 nights early August we were upgraded to a two bedroom suite which we shared with friends. I agree with other comments you need to be careful at night walking back to the hotel. The breakfast was faultless and we sat on the terrace every morning, the rooftop terrace is an amazing place from which to view toronto we booked early and got a good deal we would most certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: dubfun
Reviews.Content: I took a quick 3 day weekend trip to Toronto (my first trip there) with friends to see a ballgame and the Hockey Hall of Fame and take a quick tour of the city. The staff at the Grand was very friendly, helpful and attentive. Feeling welcome is very unusual in todays mega-chain hotels, but the Grand was top notch in that respect. Any flaws that the Grand may have vanish thanks to the staff and many complimentry features. Excellent free breakfast buffet, nice indoor pool and jacuzzi, two rooftop jacuzzis and sitting areas (make sure you use them on warm summer night!) and free gym. Underground parking is expensive, $19.00 per night, but I was not charged. The neighborhood is very colorful, but if you want a sanitized version of a city, stay on the Las Vegas strip. You will feel safe anywhere you walk in Toronto, and Toronto is a city that should be walked to be experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LovestheAuroras
Reviews.Content: We were satisfied with our stay at this hotel. The service was very good, the hotel was clean, the breakfast was decent, and the rooms were just fine. The hotel is in a not great area, but I felt safe, nonetheless. A bit outside of the city center, but the hotel itself is nice and it is close to a subway station, as well as a trolley line. Don't bother renting a vehicle, you won't need it! Also, the hotel offers a shuttle to sites within the downtown district. The swimming pool is very nice, and the roof space is very nice with plenty of seating and the hot tubs were great. The staff were attentive and very gracious. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location”
Reviews.Author: CharlieCrawbutt
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the hotel had given our children the wrong room - despite us phoning a couple of days before to confirm our booking. We stayed at this hotel; before 7 years ago and I think it has let itself go downhill. The area is not safe - especially is you are walking around to Dundas Street. Everywhere is full of beggars which is quite frightening. I would not go if you don't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value & Quality in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Bigcolsa
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend a stay in this hotel. Location and facilities excellent. From the hot tubs on the hotel roof, to the sauna and Roman styled swimming pool cannot be faulted. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms very clean and well equiped. Buffet breakfast was another highlight. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a not so nice neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: TSV
Reviews.Content: Liked the hotel, the rooms, the pool, the hot tub on the roof. Location close to everything you need, but somehow the blocks surrounding the Grand Hotel are not the nicest area. I didn't feel safe there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rileypup
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and we loved every minute of it. The rooms are very clean and comfortable and the bed was huge! The bathroom was very nice and had a great shower. We had two lcd tv's in the room and a dvd player and the safe in the room was great. We had the complimentary buffet breakfast - it's a great start to the day. The hot-tubs on the roof are fab and it's great to relax up there with a nice cold bottlw of beer. All the staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who likes a little bit of luxury for a very fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: rob1london
Reviews.Content: We had a very good time in Toronto and spent 5 nights at the Grand. The location is the only slight -ve but a quick tram ride or 5 minute walk to Dundas Sqr gets you to one of the main junctions, from which travel throughout the city is easy. The hotel is very comfortable, with a good indoor pool and well fitted gym. The saunas and steamroom are also very good. The weather meant we didn't visit the roof top jacuzi. The food at breakfast was also good. We would probably stay at the Grand if we went back to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Personal attention of staff made my trip”
Reviews.Author: Noka_9
Reviews.Content: It's not every hotel where you find a staff person who goes beyond the call of duty to make you feel comfortable. I want to thank Jen on the fron desk for ensuring that my stay was comforatlbe and for addressing my issues with friendly efficiency. Nice boutique hotel, close to the downtown core, and within walking disstance of everything I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, a very good mid-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattC1976
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand as a "get away from home for a night" trip over the public holiday weekend. I'd been forced to cancel a trip to Mexico due to the H1N1 flu outbreak so I thought I deserved to spoil myself a little. Despite it's name The Grand is a mid-range hotel - admittedly a good one. It's not in the greatest neighbourhood (it's a safe, but not particularly upmarket district) but it's only a few minutes from the city centre by cab. The bedroom was smart and well-equipped with a very nice south-facing view. The staff were efficient and well-presented, and check-in was super-smooth (I booked via Expedia rather than direct with the hotel, and occasionally that can complicate matters). The underground pool and hot tub was elegant and relaxing. Room service was efficient, the food was decent and the price was reasonable. The rooftop terrace was a little chilly in May, but it's worth a trip up there to enjoy the twilight view of the Toronto skyline even if you don't make use of the hot tubs and video screen. The bed was softer than I'm used to but I slept fantastically. The included breakfast buffet was on a par with the buffets I'm used to at various Hilton Garden Inns I've stayed in recently, so no complaints there. Overall, I thought it was great value and I'm thoroughly glad I picked The Grand.

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome place!”
Reviews.Author: teed43
Reviews.Content: What an incredible place to say. Very luxurious. The most beautiful hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff were amazing, friendly, helpful. It was conveniently located with walking distance to shopping, restaurants, coffee shops. The roof top terrace with hot tubs was fantastic and the indoor pool area is beautiful with columns and murals. The rooms were beatiful with granite top kitchette, hardwood floor, sitting area, 2 flat screen tvs. Rooms were spacious, elegant and comfortable. Will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “They charged me twice - in 2007 and again in 2009”
Reviews.Author: ChereeAustralia
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is quite nice - they could be more accommodating, and some of the front office staff could be more helpful, due to lack of ability rather than lack of being friendly. My biggest issue wit this hotel - and it's a big one - is that 2 years later, I have been charged again for the room. Almost one month has passed and they keep promising to pay back the charge but I am still waiting. I stayed and paid in October 2007. In February of 2009, using a different credit card, and while I was in another country, they withdrew another room charge! I have been in contact with the hotel on numerous occasions, and while they assure me they will refund, I am still waiting. So, despite the pleasant surroundings the hotel offers, I will never stay there and would never recommend it, due to their shady business practices- no hotel room is worth paying twice for!

Reviews.Title: “Love The Grand!”
Reviews.Author: Chief_2409
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at The Grand. The rooftop jacuzzi is a treat & offers a great view of the city. Some might find the traditional decor at bit dated, however the hotel is well maintained. The Eaton Centre is a short walk away. We have stayed in several similar downtown hotels & The Grand easily remains our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: parkerOhio
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great, rooms were good size, staff was helpful. Best part was the hot tub on the roof with the amazing view of the skyline, especially at night. They play movies on the big screen there as well (we were with a mixed age group, wish they could of had something more appropriate playing on the screen). Indoor pool area was clean and very comfortable, plenty of towels, make sure you check out the sauna in the changing rooms, fantastic place to relax. Breakfast in hotel resurant was plentiful and staffed with attentive servers. Shuttle service was offered to local attractions although you can walk to many good attractions from here as well. We would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Bachelorette Fun”
Reviews.Author: alliebagel
Reviews.Content: As a group of 10 girls looking to have a great time for an impending wedding, the Grand Hotel was the perfect location. We were pleasantly surprised with how big and open the rooms were. The floor to ceiling windows gave a great view and made the rooms feel so spacious! The small kitchen area was a great addition and the fridge was the biggest I've seen outside of a suite. The bathroom was nothing too exciting and had the strangest doors I've seen, but did the job. We were pleased that it was such a short walk to dinner. We ate at Fran's diner on Victoria. Would highly recommend it for an affordable dinner with great portions and fruity drinks! We loved it so much we had breakfast the next morning there! The rooftop hottubs were incredible! We really loved sitting up on the roof while the sun was setting. The large screen playing movies was a fun addition. We also couldn't believe how well kept the tubs were considering they were on a roof. I called my husband right away to tell him where we'd be for our anniversary! Overall, we had a great stay. I never once opened the front doors on my own - a doorman was always there. The elevators were quick, and the hotel was quiet. Will definitely, 100% stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Classy apartment-style hotel rooms, world class restaurant, fabulous indoor pool”
Reviews.Author: lowkeyguy
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the Grand Hotel and Suites is truly grand. The front desk staff are polite and efficient. Our suite was an entire one-bedroom apartment with hardwood (or faux?) floors, three flat screen TVs, large living room, small separate dining room, kitchenette, bedroom, windows on two sides overlooking Toronto. Furniture was upscale, especially the bedding. Bathroom was small but nicely decorated. The treat was the restaurant -- Citrus -- which extends off the lobby and bar area. We booked a package that included dinner and breakfast. The dinner was a choice of any appetizer, any entree, and any dessert. The food, its presentation, and the service were equal to four-star restaurants in any city. The bar, although small, was well-stocked, as they even had the grappa that I like, and had it properly chilled. There is no need to go elsewhere in Toronto for dinner if you are staying at the Grand. Breakfast was the typical hotel buffet -- eggs, sausages, bacon, potatoes, small pastries, yogurt, cereal, fresh fruit salad, coffee and juices, etc. -- perfectly adequate, but nothing special. The indoor pool area on the lower level of the hotel is very elegant -- some might say luxurious. There are hot tubs on the roof but it was too cold and windy for us to consider using them. Parking was an extra $19 Canadian (self-park). Valet parking apparently also is available at a higher charge.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay!!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler225
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked online for a Saturday night to celebrate our anniversary and will definitely be returning! We booked a standard sweet with a dinner package at the on-site Citrus Hotel. We arrived about 3PM on Saturday and had a smooth check-in; the girl at front desk was incredibly friendly with a big smile!! We were thrilled to have a room on the 18th floor and were even more excited to have a great view to enjoy being so high! Sometimes a room on a top floor means a view of the neighboring buildings walls! Our room was BEAUTIFUL! Hardwood floors, kitchenette area, big & comfy bed; it was perfect! Best of all it was CLEAN!! After enjoying the rooftop jacuzzi and the huge pool for a bit, we had an INCREDIBLE dinner downstairs. We paid $60 extra on top of our room for the dinner package, but it meant a $150 value 3-course meal for two (not including alcohol, but we had pop.. free refills)! It's a bit of a fancier menu, but everything we had was delicious! I had the Granny Smith Salad, Sirloin Steak, and Chocolate Pate, and my boyfriend had Ontario Quail, Steak, and Apple Neapolitan for desert. The waitresses were quick and attentive but not overly-so. We actually were so full from dinner and enjoyed our room so much that we changed our plans from going out partying to order some drinks and spend a relaxing evening in the hotel. There's free movie channels to watch, not that that's how we spent our romantic night in! All rooms include a free breakfast buffet and it was good as well! Eggs, french toast, potatoes, bacon, muffins, etc. We had a great time and will definitely be back in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Big Room, Big price, bit of a dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: Doogz
Reviews.Content: Having had a terrible time previously, the manager offered an upgrade to the 600$ per night Ambassador suite...sounded great. The room was 2 levels and nicely turned out (ex. the paper reproductions of Monet et al.) but the kids were stuck on the REALLY uncomfortable pull out and you cannot relax sans kids bec. the 2 floor bedroom tv over looks the sitting area...way too loud. NOT recommended for families! View sucked...faced parking lot and a tennament with a view of the balcony just below full of cigarette butts and tumbled furniture. Go for the even numbered rooms on the south side. Staff was very helpful I must say. The manager was very quick to follow up numerous emails and the desks staff followed up all calls. Cleanliness was iffy. The room (as many other contributors have suggested) needs a coat of paint and minor repairs)--I'd be pissed if I actually spent 600 not 129 on this room and had to look at all the little signs of neglect. (As an example, check out all the elevator indicator signs--ones over the doors--every floor had at least one hanging off and some floors had all 4 or 5 hanging off--real lack of attention to detail). Pool was OK although I had to call for towels and the men's sauna is still not working. The neighbourhood to the east is dodgy at best (Moss Park, Regent Park and a number of Men's hostels make for an interesting sidewalk clientele...the summer is the worst with many homeless sleeping and hanging out in Moss Park and the Armories. I have volunteered at those hostels a number of times and it's too bad TO doesn't do more for the homeless than stop them from cleaning your window.) If you stay to the west (CBD and underground PATH within 5 min.s) or south (St. Lawrence Market, Toronto Island and Front St.) or the north (Gay villiage) you'll be fine. Hop on the street car and go further east to Leslieville and the Beaches if you're not comfortable in the immediate area. Overall I would say for 129$ it was pretty darn good (roof top hot tubs working fine) decent breakfast buffet...but I would never pay 600 for that room or stay there with more than 2 ppl. The room and dinner package is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: kurzew
Reviews.Content: Nice room on last (18th) floor with great view. Large bed, 2 plasma screens and kitchen area were great. Very good complemetnary breakfast. Staff very helpful. Hotel is located 5 minutes walk from Eaton Centre (huge shopping centre) and metro station. Free Wi-Fi in the room and internet cafe at the reception. 2 jacuzzi on the roof open 24/7 with great view on the CN Tower and neighborhood. 2 minutes walk from Airport bus stop. Swimingpool and gym complementary.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_lovin
Reviews.Content: Not sure about other's negative reviews, as I've stayed here a number of times in the last month alone, and this place is great. Excellent rooms, fantastic breakfasts, and the staff is just incredibly helpful. Room service is prompt, and the food is delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Moved out after one night”
Reviews.Author: digitalcouch
Reviews.Content: Room dirty, no mattress cover on bed. Bathroom grouting very rough. Pull out couch had missing spring. They brought a roll out cot with a stained mattress, no cover, no sheets. Free breakfast consists of fake eggs and bread. Citrus restaurant did serve a good hamburger. We couldn't stand tha place and left.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Toronto Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlbr180208
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have stayed at this hotel MANY times throughout the past 5 years and we have had nothing but great experiences here. We have tried the more expensive, 'upscale' hotels in Toronto and nothing compares to this. The free breakfast buffet is soo yummy, especially after a night of drinking in the rooftop hot tubs. There's usually quite the crowd in the tubs at night, but after a drink or two everyone is friends. I can't wait for my stay this March!

Reviews.Title: “Located in Toronto's ghetto for a reason...ruined engagement and no apology”
Reviews.Author: Newsgal75
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s one thing to screw up, but TWICE? Engagement and Birthday. Then, incompetent management verbally attacks a client for complaining?? All over 200 dollars. You can put a hotel in the Toronto ghetto, but you canâ€™t call it high class. Thatâ€™s the short version. Long version and sorry if iâ€™m long winded: My boyfriend, Derek, had booked the jacuzzi suite at the grand hotel on November 1st, 2008 apparently with the plans of getting engaged (A surprise to me obviously).His idea was to propose in the hot-tub with a glass of wine, while overlooking the city. However, it didnâ€™t turn out that way. Not even close. After driving an hour, we arrived at the hotel around 330pm only to be told that the suite was not available and they had put us in an â€œupgradedâ€� room instead. It was basically just a larger room, with the bedroom in a loft area, with holes in the walls and a window view of the brick wall next door. Not even remotely romantic. Derek asked why he wasnâ€™t called in the morning so we could make alternative plans and received no response, except that we would also get private access to the jacuzziâ€™s on the rooftop after hours, which is 1230 AM, plus the outdoor temperature was at the freezing mark! While I was getting my massage (which was great), Derek went down to the front desk a couple of times to explain the situation again (when i wasnâ€™t around) and was told a manager would call the room. The phone never rang. Derek, in the meantime, called a number of other hotels ..but since it was after 5pm on a Saturday, they were all booked. Upon my return, we went for dinner and thatâ€™s where derek decided to propose instead. Of course it had a happy ending, but it wasnâ€™t close to the private, intimate and romantic evening he had planned for months. I, of course, learned of the complete disaster afterwards. We didnâ€™t use the rooftop jacuzzi and merely returned to the hotel and went to bed. You would think if a hotel knew you were using their establishment to get engaged, it would do EVERYTHING it could to make sure your plan came to fruition. I guess not at the grand. I decided to write the hotel about our â€œonce in a lifetime experienceâ€� that was ruined and received a call from one of the so-called managers. She kindly offered a complimentary stay and dinner for derekâ€™s birthday a month later. We, instead, asked for our money back. The hotel refused and only agreed to drop the room rate down to 200 dollars plus tax and the massage. I also wrote the hotel general manager, but never received a response. Derek and I decided to take the complimentary stay to at least see what we were â€œsupposedâ€� to have for our engagement, but of course, ONLY if it was for the jacuzzi suite. I called the front desk 3-4 days prior to the event to confirm the reservation, after several minutes, the girl told me she couldnâ€™t find it...under my name, dereksâ€™ name OR the confirmation number I was given by management. I told her I only had 3 minutes left before I had to return to work, but she said â€œhang onâ€� and put me on hold..then never came back in time, so I had to hang up. I called back and miraculously they found the reservation, but it was NOT the jacuzzi suite...just a basic room. Apparently, the jacuzzi suite was again unvailable and booked by someone else! I explained to the front desk that the room was the ENTIRE point of our trip, that our engagement was ruined, we were supposed to be notified etc.. etc... I wrote the manager again explaining the second screw up and she called me the next morning to IMMEDIATELY start browbeating me for not calling or emailing HER to confirm the reservation. I asked â€œisnâ€™t that what the front desk is supposed to do? Isnâ€™t it their job?â€� At this point, she accused me of yelling and screaming at the staff. I informed her that I actually work in a newsroom with live microphones about five feet away and that is completely IMPOSSIBLE! Shocking behaviour from a member of the â€œmanagementâ€� team. The manager said that the jacuzzi suite was not guaranteed until the â€œday ofâ€� the reservation, and they would not just merely â€œbookâ€� the suite for us...ONLY if someone else didnâ€™t book it already. What????? So basically, they had ruined my engagement and now derekâ€™s birthday plans as well. The manager also accused me of slamming down and hanging up the phone on her answering machine..so I had to inform her that it was a portable phone and once again, it was impossible! This is just an example of the sheer ridiculousness of this hotel. Itâ€™s almost laughable. The manager immediately went on the attack when calling me over the second reservation, continued to yell and talk over me to the point that it quickly became a shouting match of personal attacks, verbal abuse and unprofessional comments. She also tried to chastise me for calling to confirm the reservation while i was on â€œcompanyâ€� time at work. Pardon?! She basically said that Derek should have just proposed on the freezing rooftop at 1230am! I got off the phone feeling like I had been in a bar fight. Prior to working for the media, I worked in the hospitality industry for about a decade and i have never encountered such a complete lack of professionalism and basic customer courtesy. The grand hotel has none. It doesnâ€™t even practice the most basic business principle of â€œif you make a mistake, do everything you can to fix it.â€� ESPECIALLY, if itâ€™s an engagement. I think its a no-brainer that if we were supposed to get the jacuzzi suite for our engagement night, then yes, we should either get our money back or get the room complimentary at a future date. Weâ€™ve received neither. Just a bill, a whole lot of tears, nasty phone calls/emails and sleepless nights. It is soooo painfully obvious the management and staff have NO idea what they're doing. It's sad really. My engagement is a night iâ€™ll NEVER get back and although iâ€™m happy to marry the man of my dreams, i will NEVER forget what the grand hotel has done or has NOT done to make it a â€œhappyâ€� memorable event in my life. Itâ€™s painfully obvious the hotel is in DESPERATE need of money...if it is willing to endure so much bad publicity over this situation just for 200 dollars. Wow. *Update*-Two days prior to Derekâ€™s birthday the general manager e-mailed me that our original stay will be refunded, as it SHOULD have been a MONTH ago and that she was cancelling the complimentary stay. So, due to their complete lack of customer service or business sense, weâ€™ve had to endure TWO special occasions being totally ruined . OH, and we have YET to ever receive an apology. ***We were able to make a reservation for the jacuzzi suite at the Toronto Sheraton hotel, as a â€œsecond chanceâ€� engagement night and for derekâ€™s b-day..and it was WONDERFUL! We were even given a compimentary bottle of champagne to enjoy in our private jacuzzi. The room was gorgeous, buffet breakfast was fantastic and service...top notch. Plus, it was less money...so Iâ€™d highly recommend the Sheraton instead. It knows how to run a business.**** On a final note: I hope the 200 dollars was worth all this stress to the Grand Hotel. Even if â€œoneâ€� person decides NOT to stay at that hotel because of this review, THEN it was worth it to us.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Old Time !”
Reviews.Author: ALMontreal
Reviews.Content: Don't be concerned about the location factor that some have been complaining about, there is absolutely nothing threatening about the location of this hotel. Like any downtown area of a big city, this is expected. In fact the location is great, close to the Eaton Centre and other downtown Toronto sites. Very nice and clean rooms with great view of the Toronto skyline. Wood floors instead of carpets, rarely do you see that in most hotels. Friendly staff. Great indoor self-parking connected to the hotel so you can take the elevator right to the floor that your room is located on. Had a great time during my stay for the NFL's first game played in Canada and would stay there again no doubt about it. Excellent pool as well. The only drawback was the breakfast, soggy scrambled eggs and very wrinkled and dried up breakfast sausages !!

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Weekend”
Reviews.Author: delphi11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night to celebrate a family birthday. We had been a few times before, and it really is our home away from home when in Toronto. We would never stay anywhere else. Unfortunately, on this occasion, our room was not ready when we arrived (after check-in time). We returned an hour later to find that we had been given an upgrade to the two-bedroom suite. This was absolutely fantastic, and we enjoyed every minute of it. I have to admit that the breakfast offerings have slipped quite a bit since we first started going to the Grand a few years ago, but are still fine. The rooftop hot tubs are lovely, especially at night when one can enjoy a view of the city. All in all, we would highly recommend this hotel when in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: shellbux
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grand hotel before and had a wonderful time in fact I recommended it to several friends, so I did not hesitate to book rooms for a night for myself, husband and another couple. We booked in advance and when we arrived were told our room wasnt going to be ready until 1/2hour after checkin.That was not a big deal but when we returned they said it was going to be another 2 hours. They said there was nothing they could since the rooms were not cleaned.Finally received a room because someone was not happy that their room didnt have king bed as promised. Was woken up by someone obviously drunk banging on our door at 3:30 a.m. and then again at 4:00.ï¼´ï½ˆï½…Grand is a lovely property and has nice rooms and a great rooftop patio and pools but if they want to succeed they need to pay attention to customer service. I got sick of hearing from the staff " theres nothing we can do about it"

Reviews.Title: “An amazing stay at the Grand - Fantastic hotel - Great facilities”
Reviews.Author: kellycrooner
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic - we stayed for 3 nights in a Grand Double -lovely room.with lots of space for a city hotel breakfast was great- lots of choice - fresh juices - starbucks coffee - huge range of teas - pastries, breads, and hot choices - more than enough to start your day - in pleasant surroundings- the citrus restaurant was really relaxing. roof top jacuzzis were so much fun with views over the city and the lake. girls were lovely on reception as were the door men . nothing was too much trouble.....we went to niagara for 1 night then returned back to the Grand for our last two nights in toronto. My daughters could not wait to get back to the hotel... when we returned they up graded us complementary to a 2 bedroomed suite which was amazing . we thought the Grand double was nice enough but this was pure luxury and made our stay so memorable. The indoor pool is quite large for a city hotel and the steam rooms and gym were excellent... I would recommend this hotel highly for the price per room - . ten minute walk to Eaton centre

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: pilleNorwegian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on Jarvis Street in Toronto which borders on a part of town which is not so attractive. Therefore the hotel has a standard that is in such a league that it is totally able to compete with hotels more atractivelly located. The hotel manages to be a 19 floor highrise on the outside whilst on the inside it is an ancient french castle complete with rococco furniture in white and gold. The rooms are wonderful with a fantastic view from both sides of the hotel. There is a almost unnoticeable tendency to shabbyness - a loose armrest on a chair in the room, a dusty plastic plant in the reception - but you have to search for it. The WIFI is weak and slow in the rooms but complementary pc in the reception. The restaurant, Citrus,has wonderful gourmet food that can compete with the best. The breakfast is wonderful. The room service fantastic. Staff is mostly friendly and efficient. ATM in reception and a small shop with all you need. The meeting rooms are not ideal as the air conditioning is pretty noisy in some of them. On the roof there are two absolutely charming jacuzzis, in the cellar a pool and on the first floor a great gym where someone from the Sheraton will come and give you a wonderful massage after you have worked out. Or you can soak in the tub - every room has one. I have stayed here twice - each time 14 days more or less in a row. I'll stay there every time in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor management,very dirty and poor treatment of guests”
Reviews.Author: sjtownson
Reviews.Content: Essentially, we (my wife and 3 small children) arrived at the hotel to stay for 2 nights for my sisters wedding a block away. There were almost 50 people from the wedding had stayed there over the weekend. The night we arrived, I checked in and found that the key I was given did not open the underground parking. After multiple attempts, I was forced to call the front desk to open the underground parking. Once opened, I proceeded under to have the chain break (my brother was told this from the front desk) and slam down on my hood. A fellow from maintenance came about about 20 minutes later, and could not get the garage door open and told me to park in the visitors parking for the night and that I could use the back door to get in the hotel as I had all my luggage with 3 small girls, only to have the fellow close and lock the back door forcing me to walk around the front. To make a long story short, I am still fighting with them for the damage, in which they are blaming me stating this has never happened before and that I went through the garage before the door went up and broke their garage door. I informed them that I have multiple witnesses and still, they want to blame me. I have a brand new family vehicle that was leased this past January. Upon entering our room, my wife found toe nail clippings on the floor, and instead of asking to change rooms, we decided to clean them up ourselves as our daughters were exhausted and wanted to go to sleep, The deal my sister made for the rooms, included free parking, all the guests were charged for parking. After all the complaints we made while we were there, we found on-duty staff wanted to "pass the buck" and not deal with anything. Currently, I have made numerous phone calls, and over a week and a half, the General Manager has not contacted to regarding the dent in my hood and having others contact me on her behalf. Another "pass the buck"! Funny way to treat guests, as me and the entire family that stayed there over the weekend, probably spent about $20,000, and they still want to blame the guests for anything that happened to their hotel, after stating that we had a lot of witnesses. Stay away from this place!

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: diyac
Reviews.Content: this hotel was really awful. the pull out couch was old and ripped and the bed inside was noisy and uncomfortable. on the first night we asked for an iron, since the one in our room was broken. it took the hotel staff an hour to bring us a new iron. we called them twice to remind them that we needed an iron. either the front desk was not passing the message through to housekeeping, or housekeeping was just lazy. also the room was really small and not worth what i paid. there was barely any room to keep my luggage. i was only there for two nights and was irritated the entire time because of the service. avoid this hotel, because you will regret staying here just as i did!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management in a hotel with so much potential”
Reviews.Author: Cary_LA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel before and have always diligently filled out the opinion forms provided by the hotel. Sadly, none of these suggestions are ever addressed, so I come to Trip Advisor with a few words to the wise. In short, here is a hotel packed with amenities, offering rooms at lesser rates than the chain hotels in Toronto. The catch is: it's located in a section of the city rife with panhandlers (as it's just up Jarvis St from the soup kitchen) and despite some great features (which I'll go into below) poor management keeps this hotel from being a standout. First the good: free breakfast buffet (limited hours), indoor swimming pool, sauna, rooftop hot tubs, free wi-fi throughout the hotel, in-room coffee, 2 DVD players and plasma screens per room (at least), hardwood floors in the rooms, in room safes large enough for 15" laptops, daily maid service, terrific restaurant with lovely terrace (heated on cold nights) and non-smoking areas throughout. The room pillows are soft and comfy. The hotel is located three long blocks from the Eaton Centre, a mega-mall with everything including an Apple Store. Now the not-so-good: the healthy breakfast offerings are spotty: fruit consists of a bowl of melon and cataloupe (no fruit, no bananas) with no sneeze guard. Healthy cereal offerings are inconsistent. When breakfast hours end (10am), coffee canisters are not replenished. In-Room coffee replenishment is equally inconsistent. Half the rooms have torn window screens, demanding use of the in-room air conditioner which is powerful, and is aimed right at the bed and work desk, so if you are susceptible to drafts, be sure to request a room with a screen that doesn't have gaping holes in it to let in all the mosquitos, bees and other native insects. More not so good: in this time of energy conservation, the hotel keeps the hallways and indoor portion of the restaurant about 50 degrees fahrenheit. I always eat outside, even if it's raining, as it's just too uncomfortably cold in the interior common areas. There are usually doormen at the main entrance, but they rarely open the non-automatic doors for the guests. I have arrived many times with luggage and have never had one of them offer to assist me. There is one free shuttle bus for short hops around town, but it is rarely available. The beds are made with sheets not big enough for the beds, so you are likely to encounter the bare mattress instead of a fitted bottom sheet. The reception desk pays no attention to requests you might make on your online reservation, so it's best to reiterate these when checking in to make sure you are put into a suitable room. Finally, if you are here on business beware of the following: although there is free wi-fi throughout the hotel, it is painfully slow, and you will waste much time waiting for pages to load. The infrastructure needs to be upgraded, as it appears not to have been in several years. Further, the chair in each room offers no back support for working at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rr26
Reviews.Content: This place, though a little out of the way, is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in! The rooms were clean, well laid out, and very comfortable. The rooftop gives a beautiful view of the city. The staff...all the staff were very friendly and accommodating. The restaurant had great food and is very peaceful. If you don't stay here you will be missing a major treat!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: lunaWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 5 nights. There was some homeless not too far away but not a big deal. Pretty hotel and the roof is great, service was fine. Also, got a pedicure while we were there. Convenient location to everything.

Reviews.Title: “We were pleased!”
Reviews.Author: saxygirl
Reviews.Content: We had a slight delay in check-in because the non-smoking room we had booked had reportedly been smoked in by previous guests. We were re-assigned a room and were given free parking for the inconvenience. We were in what I think is called a jr. suite. It was on the 14th floor and had a nice view of the downtown area. We had a king size bed and pull-out sofa. Since our son and daughter didn't wish to share the sofa-bed, we had brought along an air mattress for use on the wood floors. Our room also had a mini fridge, microwave and 2-burner stovetop. The surrounding neighborhood is a little run-down, but we didn't feel unsafe as we walked around, and we found the location to be convenient -- just a few blocks from the Eaton Centre area and metro station. The pool area was pretty nice for those swimming. (It was very hot and stuffy for spectators!) It's a good-sized pool w/ a hot tub. There are very nice changing rooms with saunas, showers, and even suit-drying machines. The roof-top area was nice, too. There are 2 jacuzzis and also seating areas, all with a wonderful view of the city! The service was fine for us and the lobbies and hallways are lovely. The only negative I would say was breakfast. While the buffet food looked appealing, it was just so-so, and much of the hot food was cold. There were plenty of options, though, to create an adequate breakfast. We had no problems during our stay, and we found the hotel and room quite nice for the price compared to the rates of other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand was Grand!”
Reviews.Author: crath20
Reviews.Content: We had read some reviews on TripAdvisor on this hotel in March and thought it seemed reasonable. Both price and amenities were what we were looking for. Our trip was planned at the same time as the conference Million Dollar Round Table for insurance so many of the "chain" hotels were already booked. We viewed the website and liked what we saw. Right before our trip we got a little concerned because we saw people saying some nerve-wracking things about the location and property upkeep. ALL WERE WRONG!! The hotel was situated about 3 blocks from the subway. Being suburban folks with kids (7 and 10) the subway was as much a part of the trip as the attractions. We were able to walk easily each day and use this as our prime transportation (including streetcars and buses). The hotel staff was helpful in telling us what buses and subways to use and they were on target every time. The front desk and doormen were friendly and efficient. They got us taxis, towels, extra blankets, apples, museum brochures, restaurant suggestions and a smile with ease. The complimentary breakfast was nicer than the Embassy Suites in Niagara by a longshot!! Real scrambled eggs (not mixed), home-baked bread, cereals, STARBUCKS coffee, french toast, fruit, etc. were done in an elegant indoor/outdoor seating area. The restaurant is open to the hotel lobby and is elegant. The two-story pool area is a large stained glass ceiling and amazing mural. Navy blue and yellow tile give a french riviera feeling. Changerooms had bathrooms, sauna, shower and lockers. It is in a downstairs location but is not enclosed at all. Huge mirrors and topiaries make it even more elegant. The roof has a great view with two large jacuzzis, a gazebo with chaise lounges and easy chairs and an AMAZING view of Toronto and the CN tower. A local artist even chose the spot for a music video being filmed while we were there. Finally our room. A suite with an enclosed sleeping area with a fluffy duvet. The view was of the city and some apartments/empty lots in front of us. Not beautiful but not offensive. The floors were all hardwood. The pull-out coach was comfortable and moderate (Not plush but great for the kids). A large fridge, sink, plates, etc. Two bathrobes were in our closet (which was more of a built in). The room had no true closet per se. Two flat screen TVs one in living room and one in bedroom. Bathroom was marble and beautiful. The hallway, elevator and room were all well appointed and clean clean clean. Do not hesitate to stay here AT ALL. It's great. As for the location...three blocks south was a Salvation Army shelter. We were out on the street every day walking west towards the city and never saw anyone that made us feel unsafe. Many people were out and about. It was recommended to us not to go east since it could get city-ish and rough but we took a streetcar that way to go to the science center and it was just that....a city with all different kinds of people. No problems at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Easy Luxury & Value”
Reviews.Author: KWYTennessee
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel & Suites on Jarvis Street is a couple blocks east of Eaton Centre in downtown Toronto. Perhaps because it's slightly off the main streets this hotel has good rates, includes a very nice complimentary buffet breakfast (hot and cold food) and free parking - a rarity in any big city. My daughter & I were upgraded to a two-bedroom suite with a kitchenette, large balcony, 2 bathrooms. I don't know what the "normal" rooms look like, but surely the luxury duvet and pillows are the same, along with high thread count linens and spotless housekeeping. Excellent task/reading lighting throughout the suite as well as flat-screen TVs. We enjoyed the free wi-fi too. Bell staff were extraordinarily helpful with info about the North-by-Northwest Music festival. As one reviewer mentioned, stay west of Jarvis street and the hotel (i.e., towards downtown). To the east the area is frequented by derelicts - but at no time did we ever feel threatened. The indoor swimming pool and health club are as nice as photographs on tripadvisor/expedia indicate and have long hours. The rooftop view and hot tubs are fabulous on a nice day. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: jrmlcheck
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Grand June 21, 2008. After reading and reviewing their website, we decided that we would stay in the Jacuzzi Suite. When we arrived at the hotel there was no valet out front, and I think we seen one on the day we left. The entrance and lobby looked nice and the check in was fairly flawless. So we went up to our $500.00 + a night room to be greeted by a lovely floor nice kitchen all squished into our closet of a room with the Jacuzzi. The disappointment of this was astounding and ruined our stay, and the â€œmarble bathroomâ€� isnâ€™t event the equivalent of the rest room at McDonalds. The hot tub on the roof was nice, but I would highly recommend staying away in the morning as they do not seem care just how disgusting it is to try to sit and have your morning coffee with empty glasses, bottles and vomit all over the ground. Do yourself a favor and stay away, but if you do decide to go, just remember its $21.00 a night to park at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: BBAB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a 3 day business meeting. The rooms appeared worn and old. The bed mattress was really saggy and the room smelled of smoke. I agree with others, the front desk staff were helpful and friendly but the wait staff appeared bored and distracted. At more than one lunch, our plates were repeatedly taken away before we'd had a chance to finish. The food at the hotel resturant was horrible. I ordered a lobster ravioli that tasted freezer burnt- I sent it back to the kitchen. I must say though-the buffet breakfasts were very good! I'd say this was was just ok...

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but needs a little TLC”
Reviews.Author: Celticgrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night last weekend with my husband and 2 year old. Valet parking attendant was great and helped us with our luggage. Check in staff were friendly and efficient. The room wasn't bad but looked a little dated and in need of some updating. The sheets on the bed had holes in them so we changed rooms and ended up getting an upgrade. Again the room wasn't bad - quite big in fact with 3 tv's, computer, queen bed and kitchen area. Visited the pool area which is very nice. Used room service which was very quick and the food was very good. Had a complimentary breakfast in the morning which was great. Overall I would say that the service here is excellent, however the hotel could do with a bit of an update in the decor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: SopwithCamel
Reviews.Content: I have read thousands of reviews about this hotel and was wondering wether or not to stay here. I decided to book it and chose a Junior Suite. When we arrivied in Toronto, I saw the hotel was in a bad neighborhood. It looked bad but I soon discovered we would not go through it much and could easily use the streetcar that runs parallel to the hotel. Upon entering the hotel, I was astounded. The lbby was beautiful and the staff was friendly. They gladly accepted our requests. Upon entering what I thought was a large room, I discoverd it to be very small with only two beds, not enough for our family of five. The staff gladly moved us up to an Executive Suite, for a discounted price. The new room had three flat screen T.V.s and three beds. We even got a rollout bed. The room was roomy and even had a computer, though it was Windows 98. The elevators, pool, free breakfast and roof hot-tubs were great. The roof hot-tubs gave an excellent skyline view and had a changing room, gazebo and T.V.( projected on the wall )all in a nice area. The warm water even blocks out any cold air and the combination of hot and cold go good together. The store had souviners and toothbrushes, goggles, etc. and the staff, once again, were great. I could not more highly recomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: Periwinkler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand for two nights during the March Break. I was travelling wit h 3 teenagers and wanted a nice hotel with a pool and breakfast facitlities that was fairly central. I booked a junior suite because I thought it would be roomier. The room was alright but not suited to our needs. The sofa bed was not in a good location for teens to watch t.v. and it was very thin. I asked for another room the next day and they readily accommodated my request. The room with two doubles or queens (not sure) was much better. The rooms are very clean and have hardwoord type floors. Unfortunately our first room did not contain a blanket for the sofa bed or pillows. We had to wait almost 1/2 and hour for those at bed time. We could not find a blow dryer either so take one with you. Breakfast was very nice, self serve hot buffet served in the Citrus dining room. I found most of the staff to be very courteous and professional except when I checked in one of the young ladies at the counter gave me a cold look and ignored me. Thankfully another one who was friendly and appeared much more competent handled the actual check-in. The pool and other facilities were lovely and there was a peaceful relaxed atmosphere to the property. There is a shuttle available for trips to local attractions etc. The doormen were very nice. I will likely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous old fashioned grandeur”
Reviews.Author: LILSAL
Reviews.Content: A beautiful old fashioned lobby with amazing flower displays and helpful attentive staff. on reception. When we arrived there was an issue with our booking and we were given complimentary drinks while we waited. Unfortunatley the bar staff and door staff could both learn a lesson from their colleagues! The suite was great with lots of space for four adults and free internet service. The buffet breakfast was also very good with a range for both meat eaters and vegetarians. The hotel is on the edge of a very nice district and a slightly run-down area but it is just a short walk to the Eaton centre and its attractions and there is also a free downtown shuttle service which meant that we got to the CN Tower for free.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mygsds
Reviews.Content: I let almost a year slip by before writing a review for this hotel. In short, excellent! Service, staff, acommodations, food - everything was above expectations. Breakfast was divine, as were the cocktails, the rooftop views and the pool area. I wish all hotels were like this one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time at the Grand”
Reviews.Author: tarapam03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand hotel for 2 nights, and it was great. Our Junior Suites were clean, spacious, and very comfortable. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and accomodating. The location was excellent - steps away from the Eaton Centre and great shopping. We had a lovely complementary breakfast each morning including both hot and cold food. Complementary internet access was very useful in keeping in touch with family. We pretty much had the beautiful pool, whirpool, and locker room facilities to ourselves - also very clean. I will definitely be staying at the Grand hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: sosborne9
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for leisure and was very happy with our stay. Our room was bright and clean and the included breakfast exceeded our expectations. We found the location central and was able to walk back from dinner. The price was reasonable and staff was knowledgable and friendly. We will gladly stay at The Grand again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Grand”
Reviews.Author: luvinmytummy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I won a two night stay at the Grand Hotel. We stayed the weekend and we really enjoyed our stay. Check in was quick and easy and the front desk staff were very friendly and efficent. The hotel is very elegant and beautifully decorated. Our room was quite nice, we had a living room, bedroom w/ king size bed and a beautiful marble bathroom. The room had two TV's, DVD and CD player, stove top, microwave and bar fridge. We made use of the pool and hot tub....both very nice. Both change rooms contained a sauna and a neat little machine that wrings the water out of bathing suits. We went to the rooftop hot tubs, but it was too cold and windy to use them....they looked nice though and there is a great view. Breakfast was nice, though I reccomend getting there early, as they don't seem to replenish the dishes after 10am. The Citrus restaurant is very nice. We had no problems at all(discounting the guest who snuck a yappy dog into their room and then let it bark all day). The underground parking can be a little tricky, esp if you have a large vehicle, but it is very secure. You have to have a room key to access the doors. Security was adequate. There is a homeless shelter nearby, and we did see homeless people around, but never felt threatened or uncomfortable in the least. The only improvements I could suggest would be updating the decor. It looks very nice as it is, but a new carpet and a lick of paint would not be amiss. All in all, we had a really nice time and would return to the Grand!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay at a grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hippo182
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hotel for one night at the end of a holiday touring around Eastern Canada. The pool is great and the spa baths are really warm and deep. Exactly what I needed after a lots of walking. The roof terrace is a great idea. Only one of the spa baths was working but had it to ourselves so wasn't an issue. Would be nice to be able to take drinks up there but understand the no alcohol policy. Our room on the 14th floor had a great view and was well furnished. There is an area with a sofa, a kitchette (but no cooking utencils) and a bedroom area. There were also 2 TV's which was useful as my husband has become obsessed with ice hockey. The location is good for the Eaton Centre which is about 5 mins. There is also a free shuttle minibus if you are going anywhere else downtown. The comments about the unsavoury area I think are a bit unfounded. Sure there is a hostel in the area for the homeless but it is my opinnion is that all cities in the world have homeless issues and I would prefer that hostels are used and safe than having homeless people on the streets and begging. Stayed on Canadian Thanksgiving Day and ate at the hotel restaurant Citrus. The food was excellent and the pumpkin cheese cake was amazing. The hotel stored our luggage for us the next day as we had an evening flight home. It is a great process where it is checked in and you get a ticket with a bar code. Gives peace of mind as have had concerns before about leaving bags in hotel lobby's. Also we asked the hotel to book a taxi to the airport for us. It could only be described as a limo and was only C$47 in rush hour. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand by name, but is it really?”
Reviews.Author: CAJ_7
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the fact that we could get a 2 bedroom suite for the same price as 2 standard rooms. We were travelling with my wife's mother who's in her 80s, so it was easier to look after her in a suite. For what we were paying for the suite per night, we got good value for money. The room was a bit tired and some of the carpets/furniture could do with replacing and a lick of paint wouldn't go amiss, but that's all we had to complain about. It was clean, there were plenty of towels and we had everything we needed. Everything else was great. Breakfast was great (Starbucks coffee was a bonus) and set us up for the day. Wi-fi available in our room (second floor) meant I could keep up to date with my e-mail etc (Had taken my lap-top). Internet Service in the Business Centre meant I could print off my boarding cards for our flight out of Toronto. Previous reviews had mentioned the slightly unsavoury area, but we didn't have any problems. Even walking back to the hotel late one night after being at the theatre (We Will Rock You - go if you haven't seen it. Go erven if you have!) we didn't get any hassle. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Dundas Square/Eaton Centre and for everywhere else, you can either take a taxi or the hotel shuttle. Not as luxurious as some hotels I've stayed in, but as a base for first time Toronto visitors, I'd have to give it the thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel - really enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Barney_2007
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel, very close to the Eaton centre and many other attractions in Toronto. The pool is lovely and we often had the place to ourselves.
