Roof top jacuzzi's with a big screen is a great idea and the view was amazing - albeit bit chilly. Room was very comfortable and we had a good view from the 17th floor. The internet avaiable in the lobby was great for keeping in touch while we were away - although the wifi wasn't as good. Plesant and helpful staff - overall a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: OntarioJenn22
Reviews.Content: This hotel stay was a complete disappointment. We stayed in a two bedroom suite arranged long in advance and we were anticipating the evening for a long time. We stayed following a CIrque du Soleil show which was amazing, but our stay at the hotel left much to be desired. We stayed in a two bedroom suite, two guests to a room. It was clearly stated that four adults would be staying in the suite, yet we were given only 2 bathrobed, two towels, two bottles of water. When we first arrived at the hotel at 2:00 pm the room was not ready yet, as can often be expected at that time of day. The front desk attendant made a comment about how we had chosen the "highest of their rooms". SInce our room was not yet ready, we were invited to change our clothes for the show in the health club. While changing my clothes in the change room, there was a knock at the door, and a man came in saying he needed to fix the hottub. Rather than wait for me to finish, he came right in and began work just a few feet away from me. I quickly finished and left the room, astounded that the man had not even waited for me to be finished in the changeroom before starting his repairs. Since we wanted to make use of the rooftop hottub, we called for two more bathrobes which arrived quickly by very friendly staff. When we arrived on the roof, it was very crowded and there were beer bottles along the edge of the tub. The hot tub itself was luke warm and after a short time in it we were quite chilly and needed to take a warm shower to warm up. The view was wonderful. In the room, the carpets were stained and there were barely enough towels for two, let alone four adults. We were struck by the comment made by the front desk attendant about this being their "highest room", and wondered out loud what their "lowest room" would be like, given the condition of their best suite. On checkout, the desk attendant was incredibly rude, and when told that she was being rude, she became defensive, curt and continued to repeat the rude comments that were initially insulting to us. There was no such thing as "the customer is right". She told us she would meet us halfway, but when paying the final bill, she had done nothing of the sort. We were told to speak to the manager on Monday morning. On Monday the manger was not in, and a message was left for her to please return our call. On Tuesday she has still not returned our call and is not available to come to the phone. We have travelled extensively around the world in many countries, in many types of hotels. We could have forgiven the condition of the room and considered it an average place to stay, however, the behaviour of the desk staff was not only insulting and disrespectful, but also incredibly stressfull. The bad feelings caused by the experience were hard to shake for the remainder of the day, and since the manager has not been in contact with us yet, despite repeated attempts to contact her, our final very bad impression of the hotel is unfortunately the one that will stick. If you want to stay in a nice hotel, please choose another hotel as this one is average at best in terms of room condition. If you expect to be treated with respect and to not be insulted by desk staff, then please do NOT stay at this hotel, you will be sadly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “best kept secret in t.o.”
Reviews.Author: webster09
Reviews.Content: This is great value for money. All the little extras of a top chain hotel. Hotel rooms have all been upgraded with flat screen tv's. all basic hotel rooms have larger than normal hotel room fridges, small stove top, and microwave. Beakfast included is FULL buffet, hot & cold. Free downtown shuttle service mon-fri. Great rooftop hot tubs with projection movies.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Buddies
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I have just returned to Thunder bay Ontario from our stay at the grand hotel and it was great. We stayed for 6 nights (aug 3 - aug 9). The hotel staff was very helpful but when it started to get to busy for them they were a little rude. The price of the hotel was excellent for a hotel close to very thing. To get to the rogers centre, CN Tower and in that area by taxi it was around $10 with tip. If walking it is about a 20 - 30 minute walk. But if walking at night make sure you are walking with other people. The breakfest was good but it was always the same, but good for saving money on breakfest. Now for the pool and the roof top. It is a wonderful site from the roof, you can get great pictures of the area and can even see the maple leaf gardens. Pool was fun too. But during the day you can not see the big screen t.v on the roof and they are always playing much music or mtv. The room was a comfortable size for us. The maids like to short you on towels but we called the front desk to get more. I would stay again if the price is right. Yes one more thing if you are planing on going to the zoo or some where farther away ask a bell hop about there taxi serves it is a roomie car and fare price.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with the comments below!”
Reviews.Author: jjkaine
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home after spending 2 nights in Tron'o as the locals say and enjoyed hotel...however, room for 3 adults not as large as promised on website, breakfast a bit iffy but roof top jacuzzis with fantastic views of Downtown area made up for somewhat dodgy area (soup kitchen run by Salvation Army down the street and beggars near Casey's just across the road!). The roof area could be a lot better with a bar, better amenities but for a day of relaxation after seeing the sights, wonderful weather, clean towels, shower, changing areas etc it was brilliant. Would overall recommend hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, feux luxury”
Reviews.Author: Makingitstar7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights at the end of July. Had trouble opening our door but we soon got the hang of its little quirks. Once we finally entered the room, we had a mini kitchenette, a separate sleeping area, and floor-to-ceiling window. Nice for three people. However, you could see worn out places, such as wall paper pealing in the bathroom, smudges on the window, and confetti on the hallway floor. Pool was nice and large. Very deep, so keep an on your children. Work out room had several things to chose from but some seemed dated. Rooftop hot tubs were very very nice at night, however they seemed to have trouble running their outdoor movies. We once called down to the office to tell them that the screen was frozen, the clerk replied, "We don't show movies, we play music videos." This is untrue because a fellow guest had told us the very name of a movie that was playing before we got there. Overall, it was a nice hotel but if you are looking for 5 star/5 diamond service, this isn't it. Good attempt, though.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO - Not for families or people expecting "a cut above"”
Reviews.Author: Ditchkids
Reviews.Content: First we are a family 2 adults 2 children from Ottawa. Here is a list of our experienced problems; Our bathroom wreaked of urine, bathtub was very "greasy" looking and feeling. We wanted to have a sauna, 1 was not working the other wreaked of unrine and it was visible on the floor. Tried to park the car in the underground garage, was full and the corners are so tight that every turn requires a backing up proceedure to not hit the protruding walls, many cars have left their "impressions" from scraping on these walls. Ended up on the street to park. Tried to take the kids up to the "roof top" garden Hot tub area, to discover that this is a "PARTY" area for the local youth instead of the hotel guests exclusive use. My children and I witnessed an "exchange of drugs" between 2 of the youths. Then they proceeded to light up. We immediatly left the roof top! The next morning at breakfast (the food is very basic, powered eggs and stale bread not good at all) we observed 2 hotel guests in their robes, grabbed a plate fill it up and went back up to the room. What class! Needless to say we cut our stay short and checked out! We completed our vacation at the Intercontenental Hotel and enjoyed the "CLASS" of this hotel. Spend the extra money and stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: ladyluckUk
Reviews.Content: After a long trip from UK we arrived excited to start our 1st trip to Toronto.....arrived at reception to be greeted by staff...felt like we were putting them out asking for our room....apparently the suite we had booked "was not available"....the only room they had was a dbl for our family of 4....I had booked a suite and even sent email asking that it all be in order for our special trip......after voicing our opinions a room WAS available..but had just not been cleaned....was 4pm??........ Room eventually up to standard......dining staff and door men lovely and very polite...girls on reception...too much attitude and do the hotel very little justice....wont be staying again.....room top whirl pool brill but dont expect the area to be clean in the morning....takes a few hours to remove plates/bottles/glasses from the night before.....Great shame as overall hotel and staff have potential......serious change needed from dolly birds on front desk!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Grand Hotel, excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: jackipel
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights at the Grand Hotel with our two boys 15 & 17 yrs old. We were delighted with our room, the pool, hot tubs and the view from the roof. It was an experience we will always remember. The hotel staff was very friendly, helpful and polite. We ate at the Spegatti Factory and took the shuttle from the hotel to Esplanade St, and the driver was very nice. We walked to Bloor St from the hotel to eat at the Groundhog Pub. Both restaurants had great food and service. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was excellent, and we ate outside on the patio both mornings which was nice. For 4 people in a room, we had plenty of towels which were also supplied at the pool. The rooftop hot tubs were just awesome. The pool and roof areas were very clean except in the early morning at 5:30am the roottop was trashed, so I guess you could have a party all night long if you wanted too. We were able to ride a subway for the first time and after learning what to do and how to get a day pass it was very easy to see many of the sights. We experienced many helpful people from Toronto asking if we were lost and gave us directions. We were all impressed with how friendly people were in Toronto. The price of the hotel was well worth the money spent. I booked the Grand Double Room and was upgraded to an Executive Suite this was a two level room with 2 bathrooms, 2 tv's and a nice size living room and kitchen area. We took many pictures and hopefully will be able to share on this site. We only paid $169 a night for 4 people with the breakfast buffet included we got a wonderful deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Customer Service/ Unreliable”
Reviews.Author: ChloeJ123
Reviews.Content: I had reserved 4 rooms at this hotel in early 2007 for an event taking place in July. Four days before the event I called to confirm the guest rooms and the conference room that had been booked for our use on a "complimentary" basis. The reservations clerk, "Amanda", informed me that the conference room would no longer be complimentary, but would instead have a cost of $100, since I had asked for 10 chairs to be set up. When I explained that this was unacceptable, I was met with some very rude and uncalled for remarks. I asked to speak to the General Manager, "Heidi," to see if the situation could be salvaged. After being interupted by Heidi several times during our two minute conversation, she actually told me that she no longer wanted my party to be guests of the hotel. I was so shocked by this treatment that I didn't even know how to respond. I was left scrambling to find another venue in downtown Toronto for an important event on four days notice. Obviously, this was extremely disappointing. I will not be giving the Grand Hotel any future business and would warn others against booking important events there. They are not a reliable company, nor do they understand basic customer service principles.

Reviews.Title: “â€˜Sophistication without Pretensionâ€™”
Reviews.Author: Paul025
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand last year and have to say we had a fantastic stay. The hotel describes itself as â€˜Sophistication without Pretensionâ€™ and I have to say I fully agree with this statement. The rooftop hot tubs with big screen is definitely one of the hotels major selling points. It was great fun sitting there watching movies with views over the Toronto night-time skyline. Hotel restaurant was great and the staff were very helpful. Ok the Hotel is not in the best area, however we did not experience any trouble ourselves. Having stayed here we felt like we had been treated like celebrities. If you are in Toronto look no further than the Grand!

Reviews.Title: “It is my number one choice for hotels in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyReview
Reviews.Content: I have stayed and the Grand a few times and every time a go I am treated well by all the staff. The rooms are nice, the pool and gym are great, the food is top notch, and I love the roof top patio. It is the only place I stay when I visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret in Canada!!”
Reviews.Author: newcityeveryweekend
Reviews.Content: Friendly service, great food, clean upgraded rooms, and a great central location in downtown Toronto! Our family really enjoyed our week long stay!!! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place--ignore bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: swilli63
Reviews.Content: I researched online to find the perfect hotel. My boyfriend and I were staying in TO and wanted a nice, not too pricey hotel. This one was perfect for us. Cheaper than most of the hotels in Toronto, it was a very positive experience. The staff is soo friendly, the rooms are perfectly clean and of good size. The best part would be the rooftop--two jacuzzis and a large screen TV overlooking beautiful Toronto. It couldn't have been better. Before leaving I read other people's reviews, and I was nervous, but I found none of them were true. As for the SECURITY issue---there is underground parking with a closed door only accessible by those staying at the Grand, so it was as secure as could be. DEFINETLY STAY HERE, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: swellings
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel early approx 1pm and checked in with no problem. Our deluxe suite room was lovely and the beds and pillows were so comfortable. We later found out that the hotel just borders on the red light district and there was a hotel which looked like a strip bar opposite but we never had any problem and we never saw any undesireables. Although we only stayed one night we walked back from town at approx 11pm with no problem. Someone mentioned the begging outside the hotel but we didn't see any, although there are beggars laying in the streets in other areas of toronto. The hot tub on the roof was what made us go to the hotel but unfortunately we didn't get to try it or the pool because i was ill. When we were checking out i was very unwell and fainted in reception and my husband asked for help from the staff who were very good. I didn't get to try breakfast but my husband was there for 1 1/2 hours so it must have been good. We would definately go back to tis hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience at a hotel with great potential”
Reviews.Author: mominparis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand during March break of 2006. We loved our stay so much that we returned mainly for the beautiful pool. We have lived in Toronto all of our lives and know the city very well. We were aware that this hotel is in the worst location in the city. When we arrived, we were hounded and followed all the way to the front door for money. We looked out our room window to see unsavoury people walking around the parking lot trying to break into cars. We informed the desk . They have not security on the grounds. The underground parking lot that the hotel offers is VERY VERY narrow and most vehicles come out scratched and or dented. We recently purchased ournew van and thought one evening that we would not risk the damage to this new vehicle. The hotel has posted signs that indicate outside parking is not overnight. We would have wanted to have been advised that leaving the car in the parking lot would have serious consequences. Since the parking lot is not gated, many of the wondering street people come in to look for money in the parked cars. Our van's windows were smashed. There really was nothing to take. Our vacation was ruined. We had to return home. Although the manager was sympathetic, she offered no compensation and said that this problem is prevalent. Such a shame. The hotel is beautiful, clean, and staff is friendly. The $1000 damage to our van could have been avoided if the hotel had better security in such a drug-infested neighbourhood. Guests should be warned. Grand hotel but don't risk it.

Reviews.Title: “The Affordable Luxury- The little secret”
Reviews.Author: teenagesloth_prod
Reviews.Content: For the money- this hotel is a great bang for your buck. It is fancy but you will pay much less then other TDOT hotels and still walk away feeling like a star!! *Grand deluxe Room is great for a 2 adult 2 kid family. *Complimentry Full Breakfast, inroom movies and beautiful linens make it extra special. *Rooftop hottubs and the outdoor nightly movies are the best on a cold winter night (if you dare)

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, no good”
Reviews.Author: Online-Contributor
Reviews.Content: Normally I wouldn't take the time to write a review on my experiences somewhere, but this hotel gave me reason too. This hotel had been recommend to us by some friends for the breakfast but we had a different experience. I hold an Entertainment card, in which the Grand advertises 50% off the "rack rate". I'm not really into the lingo of hotel ad's but when I wanted to use my card for a discounted rate, I was told it amounted to $10 off a $200 dollar room. When I questioned the front desk they said "oh, ok we'll give you $20 off". The breakfast was nice. But there were so many staff standing around and no one really talked to us or brought us the bill. We had to ask for it ourselves. The housekeepers were really nice. Always smiling and saying "hello". When we requested clean towels we waited an hour because somehow the request hadn't been put through. The beds are comfortable, but the walls are scuffed and the curtains were filthy. Our stay wasn't so horrible as it could've been. But on the whole we felt ignored by staff, and any concerns we had were neglected. No one seemed really happy to be working there and never once did we see a manager on the property. Sorry, but it just wasn't that nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Poor Area”
Reviews.Author: KJS2003
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a superb stay at The Grand (2 adults & 2 kids aged 18 & 11). From the moment we checked in till the moment we left the staff were excellent, particularly Alex & Lito the doormen. Nothing seemed too much trouble for anyone at the hotel, despite what I have read elsewhere. Our accommodation was first class (thanks for the upgrade) with 2 en suite bathrooms which suited us perfectly. The amenities at The Grand are fantastic - the rooftop hot tubs are a must and the pool & gym are both excellent. Our complimentary breakfast set us up nicely each day, with a good selection for all tastes. The only downside to the hotel (which is compensated for by the service & amenities) is the surrounding area. This is scruffy & rundown, with a few homeless hostels nearby, which resulted in lots of beggars hanging around. We didn't experience any bother with these guys but it wasn't conducive to a night-time stroll to take in the sights. Overall, I would have no hesitation in recommending The Grand, and if I return to Toronto, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ghetto neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Dingaling
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great once you're inside. However, be careful walking around here at night. There are quite a few seedy joints surrounding this area, and people to match. The hotel inside is clean and new, so it would be good if the surrounding area started cleaning up in order to attract more business.

Reviews.Title: “good stay at the Grand”
Reviews.Author: toddsande1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hotel last week (September 4). I was really impressed by this hotel's level of service and professionalism. Since it is a smaller hotel, I really felt at home compared to some of the larger hotels that I have stayed at before in Toronto. The hotel was relatively close to the eaton center and the financial district. Also having access to the internet and business center services was quite helpful. The pool was also quite large and I used it quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “You Must stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sttmfm
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at hotels such as the Four Seasons, King Edward, Royal York and Sutton Place, I must admit I was a bit skeptical as to whether the Grand Hotel could live up to my high hotel expectations, but I was in for a pleasant surprise! As soon as we arrived I noticed the beautiful reception area and the huge dining room and terrace. The staff were so friendly and when we checked into our room I was amazed! Huge high ceilings, a two storey loft-style gorgeous room, the most comfortable bed and- 24 hour room service! The Grand has an excellent work-out facility, with both cardio machines and weights, and the pool decor reminds me of a greek vacation. Afterwards, we went up to the rooftop jacuzzis and watched some muchmusic on the giant t.v screen. I escpecially loved the buffet breakfast and I recommend the "Dean Martin shrimp cocktail" to anyone going for dinner at the delicious Citrus restaurant. Overall, the staff, atmosphere and service of the Grand Hotel has made it my new favorite spot and I will recommend it to anyone visiting the downtown Toronto area. Thanks again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Shiny happy hotel in a rough neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: hankstamper
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal online for a nice room with a beautiful view -- the small suite with a foldout couch was perfect for our family of four. The hotel staff was pleasant, knowledgeable and helpful, with lots of tips for getting around. The location is not excellent -- it's on the outskirts of downtown, and the neighborhood is a bit scary even for those of us from other large cities -- but the hotel provides a free shuttle, and we were able to walk to restaurants and shopping without a problem. The pool room was hot and overchlorinated but adequate to calm down the kids before dinner. All in all, a nice stay, and we'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Grand - a very satisfactory experience”
Reviews.Author: The_Sherriff
Reviews.Content: I was very favourably impressed with this hotel, having booked it in some desperation because Toronto was crowded with 20,000 delegates to an AIDS conference and there was practically nothing else available. Front desk were very helpful, bellmen especially so. The room was clean and did not feel cramped, although I agree with reviewers who couldn't swing a cat in the bathroom - but how often do you want to do that anyway? I thought the rate seemed expensive but, when you throw in free -and simple-access to wi-fi in every room and an excellent complimentary breakfast, the net cost per night is comparable with hotels of the same class elsewhere. True the area outside is 'improving' but not so rough as to upset any but the more prissy traveller. The homeless guys from the Salvation Army hostels are pretty harmless and the gentrification east of Yonge means that there are ways of avoiding them if you don't want to be hustled - but it's a useful reminder that we don't all have affluent and well-ordered lives and a darn sight safer than Durban where I was two weeks ago.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service and Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mr.Randhawa
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful and very luxurious. Every ammenity was available to us. We stayed at the Grand after our wedding and we couldn't leave. The complimentary breakfast was amazing everyday and the room was spacious yet cozy. Dinner at Citrus on the main floor is something that shouldn't be missed. Beautiful decor and a gorgeous rooftop patio. The service and Management was more than we could have expected, and catered to our every need. We would highly reccommend this hotel to all visitors of Toronto and even locals who need a getaway. It's the perfect combination of luxury, elegance and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: steven_4444
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the grand after seeing their ad in the air canada magazine. I must say that after staying at many hotels in toronto over the years, the grand went beyond my expectations. I found the room to be quite spacious, giving me enough room to work and relax. The patio on the roof is a great place to take some sun and get a nice view of the city. I really enjoyed citrus restaurant, food and service was great. i will return the next time i'm in toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: finnmann
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hotel Toronto with my family in July and really enjoyed it. upon arival our pre booked room wasn't available, however, we did receive an upgrade in to a 2 floor loft with kitchen etc.. . The hotel was well appointed decorated hallways, pooland sauna were nice, doormen always on duty. Nice morning buffet breakfast. The neighborhood was a bit dodgey with a center for the homeless nearby but heah that is Toronto. Eaton center was a short walk away. I woundn't hesitate to make a return visit or recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in T.O”
Reviews.Author: SarahJA
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home from my Canadian Getaway. The hotel is fantastic and we have never experienced such incredible service before. Our room always looked spectacular, and the front desk staff was always extremely helpful. We ate a couple meals at the hotel which were both great. I would recommend this restaurant and hotel to anyone travelling into Toronto or that even live in Toronto! I've visited Toronto many times and love the city, yet i've never wanted to stay in the hotel so much before. The roof top was beautiful at night or in the day. If you want to mix a little luxury with the odd trip to Toronto then this Hotel is an absolute must.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You..Grand Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: 5Sunny5
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel in the City I travel all across Canada for work, and I it can be very lonely at times. I'm in a different city, away from my family, but when my work sends me to Toronto, I'm a little less lonely....... I get to go back and see all the warm and friendly staff at the Grand Hotel who know me by name now. The price of for what you get, is very reasonable..... They serve a great complimentary breakfast. and they don't charge you for using the internet.. I have even been upgraded to "loft suite" Thank you Grand Hotel staff....for making my stays so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: BRok
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night and wish that I could have stayed for more. From the great staff at the front desk to the amazing roof top patio, this hotel is first class. I found every amenity they had available to be luxurious and parallel to the rest of the fine service provided by the hotel. I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: KrazyJalfrezi
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our week long stay at The Grand. The hotel was something else, the service from the receptionist girls was a real asset to our stay and an asset to the hotel. We stayed on the 12th floor and the views of the city were fantastic only bettered by the roof top hot tubs. The indoor pool was a real benefit to the hotel. The rooms were large and clean. It was a real suprise having a complimentary shuttle downtown, very handy when we wanted to go to the CN Tower of the baseball game saved money on taxis and time walking. Breakfast was great and sitting out on the terrace in the sun with the birds singing is fantastic. I would reccommend the hotel to my friends anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: tpadvisorwalker
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Grand and really enjoyed our stay. Our first 2 nights in Toronto were at the Royal York which was fine but we actually preferred the Grand. Yes, the area isn't the best, but I visited with my mother and 5 year old daughter and felt OK. Take a cab at night. I live in one of the safest and most remote areas of Scotland but was able to accept this is the reality of big city life. Our room was lovely; very spacious, certainly compared to the Royal York, the pool wonderful and the staff with the exception of one of the receptionists, were charming. I was quite worried about staying here after reading the reviews, but our whole experience was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for our needs”
Reviews.Author: PennyBermuda
Reviews.Content: Myself and a group of (Middle aged) girlfriends had decided to visit Toronto for a long weekend to chill and shop! I was expecting a really poor location - but we were only four blocks from the metro centre and the area wasn't that bad. (I've certainly seen a lot worse) Had originally booked a junior suite but was lucky enough to be upgraded to a two storey hotel room. Whilst the hotel is a bit old it was certainly everything i had hoped for. Our "apartment" was HUGE! the staff were mostly nice with the exception of one "lady" on reception who we all agreed could work on her 'people' skills. Spent the last night eating curry and drinking wine of the roof with the most fantastic sunset, what a wonderful way to finish off the holiday. I loved the fact that we weren't getting billed for every little extra - i.e. movie channels, internet use, spa facilities etc. Breakfast was certainly better than i was expecting and gym, pool and roof top sauna was great fun. Would take my hubby back one day just for the roof top wining and dining! Would go back

Reviews.Title: “Fraught with Frustration”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After viewing the hotel's website, I was surprised by the hotel's actual appearance. In my opinion, the photos are a bit misleading. Additionally, the hotel is situated next door to a "halfway house" type hotel that rents rooms by the month. We were advised not to stray too far to the right of the hotel in our exploration of Toronto. However, the most unfortunate experience at the Grand was that electronic equipment went missing during our stay. After we ransacked the room and I retraced my steps in my mind, I felt compelled to inquire into the hotel's Lost & Found. This involves leaving a message on a voicemail at the front desk. Not satisfied, I went down a bit later and spoke with the night manager, Renee. He was courteous, helpful and apologetic about the situation. The next morning upon checkout, I was informed that the General Manager, Terrance, was fully aware of the situation and I was given his card. I asked that I be updated upon his arrival later that morning. By the next day, I still had not heard from Terrence, so I called from home. He informed me that this was the first he had heard of the situation. "Someone would call me back". He was dismissive, patronizing and blaming his employees for the miscommunication. Needless to say, I was unimpressed. By the next day, you guessed it, I had to call the hotel again, this time asking for someone above Terrence. I was told the Grand is an independently owned & managed hotel, so Terrence was it. I was, however, given the name of the Sales Director, "Because she is good at returning phone calls". The front desk called later that day to say nothing turned up in the Lost & Found (Friday- I reported it missing Tuesday evening). I asked to speak with Terrence about other alternatives and when I did, I was interrupted, "bullied" and shouted at. Only when I suggested a police investigation, did he agree to a key entrance & security tape check. Dont' get me started on the hotel's in-house car service to the airport. Do yourself a favor and hail a cab. It costs roughly the same and you won't have to risk an unnoticed car order in the logbook, missing luggage or the wrong luggage (I hope she got it back by now) in your trunk. The Grand is poorly managed, and (Renee & Heidi aside) lacks basic hospitality and customer service skills. Needless to say, I will not stay there again, nor recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bad, very Bad location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Travelled to the Grand Hotel for a 3night trip with a friend, stayed here as it had great reviews from work mates. I usually stay in the Fairmont Royal York but this was fully booked so we stayed here instead. The area is disgusting, dirty, unsafe (due to busy main road) and the homeless people, I feel for them I really do but do they have to keep asking u for 25cents or a dollar. The room was average, but only average nothing to write home about, save ur money. Im there on a holiday not on a charity mission. If I could offer any1 advice, dont stay anywhere near Jarvis Street, stay at the Delta Chelsea or the Fairmont Royal York, or anywhere close to Union Station.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Grand Hotel. Here is a summary of my experience: - The hotel is nicely appointed. There is a lovely patio on one side accessible from the restaurant (quite nice) and conference rooms. - My suite was small but well appointed and clean. It was cleaned and made up every day no problem. Bedding was alll white including the comforter. Bedding and sheets were crispy clean. There was a small kitchen area, which I used (fridge, coffee maker, plates, cups and cutlery), but there were no pots or pans, so you couldn't use the stove, if you wanted to. - The pool was as pictured on the web-site, as were the roof-top hot-tubs. - I found the hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful, from the doormen to the front desk to the restaurant / bar to the house-keeping staff. I would say above average service. - I thought the food was quite good, again above average. The neighbourhood is iffy (its downtown Toronto). We were advised not to walk alone at night (which I didn't). I saw more disturbing sights along Queen Street West than anywhere in the vicinity of the hotel. Let's face it, Toronto has a significant homelessness problem in the downtown core, so if you are coming from a smaller city, you may, like me, suffer some culture shock. This has nothing to do with the hotel and is not limited to the Jarvis area by any means! There is also a good coffee shop across the street called "Steam".

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend with friends of ours. We were looking for something relatively inexpensive to share. We had a spacious room with kitchenette, separate pull out couch and chair, two double beds. There was complimentary breakfast that was enjoyable, a large indoor pool and jacuzzi. There was also two rooftop jacuzzis where they were projecting videos on the building. It was a nice hotel for the price we paid. The staff was friendly, the bar was nice. The rooms were clean. The bathroom was a little small. It was within walking distance to downtown attractions. The neighborhood was a little sketchy, but seemed safe. I'd recommend it for a comfortable stay at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: adventurewoman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the grand hotel in june 2005, Amazing swimming pool and roof top sun garden views were magnificent. Restaurant was very nice with seating outside as well as in very pretty and good food. Room was not large but clean and a little kitchen so you could economise on food a little if you wished. I would recommend this hotel if your visiting toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined Romance - Lousy Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel in Toronto may have been an excellent accommodation at one point in its brief history as a "boutique" hotel, but that time has passed. Since its transformation from the former Toronto headquarters of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, this hotel is now showing its age. My wife and I (both Toronto residents) went on a mid-winter romantic break in January for a Saturday night to the Grand Hotel. On the advice of a co-worker (who had thought it great), I booked the "Grand Jacuzzi Suite". My expectations were high - Jacuzzi tub, great view, king sized bed, pricey room. My disappointment began at the check-in; the Jacuzzi was broken & the suite was out of service. No problem; given adequate notice, I could reschedule. However, the Front Desk never made any attempt to contact me to advise me of the situation. Strike 1 against the hotel for poor customer service. I accepted a night in Room 205 - an "Executive Suite" with no discount offered for the inconvenience (plus they charged $16 for parking under the hotel). The Executive Suite consisted of 4 ill-shaped rooms - an "office", a queen bed, a sitting room with a rock-hard couch and a kitchenette. The first problem when you walked in the door was that there was no place to hang your coat. Unlike a regular hotel room, an Executive must feel that there is no need to have your coat anywhere near the door. The bathroom shows its age â€“ cracked walls, mis-matched fixtures, no shelves or sink surrounding countertop for your toilette articles or accessible mirrors for those of us with glasses to get anywhere near. My wife ended up wedging herself between the sink and a wall to get close enough to a mirror to apply her makeup. The â€œfit and finishâ€� of the room was poor â€“ trim and mouldings had gaps and showed signs of repairs in the past. The patio door out to the shared balcony was old and ill-fitting, letting the winter winds whistle through. What Mike Holmes would make of this place would be interesting to hear. The office room had a laughably ancient and slow computer and Internet connection with a ceiling fixture that was missing its glass shade. Naked bulbs are terribly attractive in a $300 a night room. The bed was oriented on an angle to try and fix the strangely shaped room, but was in such a position that the one bedside table (there werenâ€™t two for each side) couldnâ€™t be positioned near the side of the bed. The headboard was a tall, solid piece of dark wood with an enormous gap (about 3 foot) between the surface of the mattress and the bottom of the headboard. Consequently, you couldnâ€™t pile any pillows up to lean your back against because they would fall through into the triangularly shaped space behind the bed. The hotel restaurant's buffet breakfast was a poor excuse for a hotel in Canada's largest city. I've had better eating in hotels in small town southern USA. Even the floors are worn - it must show better in the dark. All in all, an extremely poor experience. I would never return there unless a lot of money is pumped in to fix the place up. We noted the problems with the room in detail on the hotel's comment card and just received a form letter from the General Manager making no mention of our complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined Night!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMasterToronto
Reviews.Content: I booked the Jacuzzi Suite for Feb. 14/2006 in hopes of spending a surprise romantic evening with my loved one. I had paid cash (three months in advance) and had planned everything. I wanted Valentine's 2006 to be very special..... I had hoped to get into the room and set it up - had the champagne, strawberries, chocolates, candles etc. and was stunned to be told at 4pm that the room wasn't ready yet!!! Check in is at 3pm..... Actually, a friend who had told me about this Hotel had the same thing happen to her just the weekend before the 14th. Must be common practice at this Hotel - not ready for the 3pm check-in & the offering of complimentary drinks in return for their lateness! The staff in the lobby asked me to have a seat while they checked on the room. A few minutes later I was told the room wasn't quite ready and given a complimentary drink ticket for the bar. My immediate response was that I wanted to get into the room to set it up before my loved one arrived - it was supposed to be a special evening and a surprise. They offered what they told me was a "far superior room" and guided me up to their third floor to see it. It was a nice room, however, no jacuzzi in sight. Call me silly, but isn't Valentine's Day about romance??? This room just didn't "do it" for me. My partner was due to arrive any time, and I felt I had no choice in the matter but to graciously accept this far "inferior" room. My partner was waiting in the lobby after I had checked the room out. It was so disappointing, no surprize, no jacuzzi.... We went for dinner in the hotel restaurant and told them at the desk we would rather wait till the Jacuzzi Suite became available. We ended up getting into the suite around 9pm. (As it turned out, the room was still saturated from water from the previous occupants of the room.) Upon check-out the staff were sympathetic about our ruined evening and gladly gave me the General Manager's card. When I conveyed my story to Terrance, the General Manager of the Grand Hotel, I was quite surpised at his reponse. He felt quite happy about the whole situation felt it had been handled properly by his staff. Also, he felt no obligation to reimburse or perhaps offer another night in compensation for our ruined "Valentine's Day". Having said that, and after reading some comments by others who have stayed at this Hotel, I feel I've gotten off easy though. I will never again stay at this Hotel. In fact, I've already told some people who were planning to stay at the Grand and have now cancelled their plans and are staying at the Marriott downtown. (A "far superior" Hotel in a better neighbourhood with "far superior" Management who know what the Hotel Business is all about!) Oh yeah, Terrance if you're reading this, you have no idea what benefits you could have reaped. I work in an industry that is constantly being asked, "can you recommend a Hotel for me during my stay in Toronto?" I'll be sure to mention NOT the Grant Hotel! P.S. Sorry I hung up on you too Terrance. However, you really should attend some "Hospitality" courses. It was your condensending attitude that made me do it! You could learn something about graciousness from the helpful women at the front desk.....

Reviews.Title: “You'd have a better stay in a dark cold alley”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let's see - they gave us a suite that was not cleaned for two days. Then the ceiling started leaking water all over the place and no one seemed to think this was a problem. We were given a choice between staying in two small economy rooms or in the leaky suite we were in. Why didn't they move us to the other suite? Because they gave that room away, despite the fact that we had a reservation for that night and refused to move the other people. The manager refused to speak to us, the front desk staff literally BELITTLED us in front of other guests, and when we tried to check out they ignored us and it took more than FOUR hours for us to leave. We refused to pay for our last night, due to the ceiling leak and the lack of housekeeping services, and while we were given an invoice listing a $0 balance, the Grand decided after the fact to charge my credit card more than $500 including for services we hadn't used (additional parking charges etc). I disputed the charge through the credit card company who in the end after two months reversed the charges because The Grand Hotel never bothered to respond to any of their communications. Neither did they respond to mine. To date my letter of complaint is still outstanding. I complained to the Toronto Tourism Agency and when I followed up with them, they informed me that The Grand Hotel had told them they had offered me their apologies, an explanation and a complimentary stay but I had refused all of it, which is a total utter lie. It was the most horrible and demeaning experience of my life, and completely ruined my 30th birthday celebrations. So if you want to be defrauded, have your safety put at risk, not receive even the most basic of services, be demeaned and belittled by staff and and lied to and insulted in every way possible by a bunch of crooks, I suggest you stay at The Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Why We Return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Toronto's Grand Hotel has become a home away from home for us. We travel to Toronto to visit our college age kids, realtives, friends and conduct business. We have certain special requirements that the hotel has never failed to meet. The staff have met the diverse needs of our visits time and again and have accomadated our needs in manner that can only be described in superlatives. The hotel shuttle service is sensibly used and is a really great feature when travelling with older folks and really young children. The hotel has some great facilities.. but the friendly and professional staff is the main reason that whenever we have to travel to Canada we make up reasons to return to the Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but hardly grand”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveller
Reviews.Content: Just read the 2004-05 reviews to see if I could add anything. I used the fitness, pool, business ctr, breakfast buffet and had a look at the laundry room. The hotel is good, but there are problems, most mentioned by other posters. The "suite": small. Tattered carpet, peeling paint by the windows, dishes but no cooking utensils. Wall pictures are tacky - cheap frames and not matted. There is crown moulding, but not finished properly. Enjoyed a great southerly view. Bathroom is okay, but nothing special. Didn't care for the cheap bathroom door (2 panels that swing together) and no fan switch. Good pool - but not as magnificent as pictured on the hotel website. The fitness room (on another floor!) is large; the equipment is okay. In the changeroom, couldn't figure out the whirlpool controls, but the steamroom is great. When I returned next day, it was evident that shower stalls hadn't been cleaned. The tv screen for the adult programs indicates they are accessible with a call to the front desk.. so I concur with the poster that suggested the teenager of the irate poster may have made a call. Laundry room has padded chairs around a tv, which is a bonus. The breakfast buffet is way beyond continental. It includes scambled eggs, french toast, bacon, sausage. Most impressive. However, the restaurant's wood floors are in desperate need of paint; the black paint is hideous with it's wear. The doorman at the front is hit or miss with opening the door for you. Seemed to be often busy doing nothing. The business centre has 3 computers. Elevators can be e x t r e m e l y slow. The good? Great breakfast, comfy beds, big windows, kitchenette. Overall, the place needs more money invested in it to make it grand.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, fantastic pool and roof-top patio”
Reviews.Author: Winterhude
Reviews.Content: I've been to Toronto many times on business and vacation with my family and this is our favorite Hotel. The breakfast buffett is a great value and way beyond what typically is included. The rooms are beautiful and nicely decorated, but not huge. The little kitchinette is good to have - keeps your beverages cold and allows you to heat up snacks. Don't plan on cooking- but why would you with so many great restaurants near by! The pool and roof top patio are the best. If you have kids- don't stay anywhere else. My daughter dosen't to ever leave the pool!

Reviews.Title: “I'm saving to return already !”
Reviews.Author: Lyndamac
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have just returned last week from a 10 day stay at this wonderful hotel and I find it hard to beleive we were at the same hotel at the same time as the traveler from Whitby ! We arrived from the airport at 11a.m and hoped to store our bags till check in time. What a wonderful surprise when we were allocated our room and given a card with complimentary drinks for our anniversary. The room was very clean including the sheets. We had an excellent view of the lap dancing club behind the hotel ( we never saw anyone going in though!) The breakfast on the patio each morning was excellent . I could also go on at great lengths about the roof top hot tubs, what a unique experience. In all the time we were there the staff were without exception pleasant and polite and should we ever be fortunate enough to visit Toronto again would not consider going anywhere but The Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Yep ill be back again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Grand Excellent meet all my requirements there not a lot more you can say about a very good hotel, and all the were very helpfull too what a pleasent change. They have realised that people using hotels are usualy from out of town or perhaps on holiday there and are well!! very helpfull. thanks for a nice pleasent stay there keep it up ian

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle2411
Reviews.Content: Have just arrived back from the Grand and I must admit I was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews! However, never went behind the hotel (had no need) and the walk to the Easton centre is a couple of blocks and tooks about 5 minutes. The area between the hotel and the Eaton Centre is a little run down due to the state of some of the shops, however, me and my husband had no problem walking around during the day. We did take taxis's at night but then I would'nt walk around bits of London in the dark either. The hotel itself was beautiful and the staff very helpful. We did have a problem the first night as the hotel could'nt find our booking, however in the end they did but they were fully booked for that night so they moved us to the penthouse suite in the Comfort Suites next door (which was OK but isn't a patch on the Grand) and gave us $150 voucher in spend in their restaurant (which served very good food although the portions were a bit too big), so I suppose they did their best. The breakfasts are fab and you can either eat in the restaurant or on the patio which is heated (just watch out for the black squirrels and the sparrows!). The rooms were excellent and very clean and modern. Whilst we were there, there were alot of actors (including someone from Eastenders), so it can't be that bad! I would post some photo's of the fantastic views from the rooftop but unfortunately I put my camera in my suitcase which has been lost by Air Transat (along with most of my good clothes and things I bought), so please pack your camera in your hand luggage. I normally do, but because I had a lot of hand luggage I thought it would be safe in my case and that this sort of thing would never happen to me!

Reviews.Title: “Hated it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What can I say about the GRAND Hotel... It is not GRAND at all. First off the staff are rude. When we arrived at the hotel, are reservation was not found. It took the clerk about 15 minutes to find it, acting as though I was an idiot who did not book it. Forgiven. She thought the Ist name was the last. When we finally did arrive in are room, (no help bringing in the luggage) the room was very dissapointing. When I called to book the room, I was told there was a full kitchenette with all the fixings. I couldn't make a grilled cheese if I pleased! No pots, pans, not a knife worth cutting anything! I could go on! The bathroom... The shower had such a bad malfunction, you did not know if you were going to be burned or frozen everytime you used it! God forbid you even get it on in the Ist place, turning it off was worse!!! To top off the bathroom experience, the Ist night it overflowed!! Asked front desk if we could move to another room and were told they were booked. The 3rd night, the toilet would not stop running all night! LOUD!! How is this for a romantic annivesary! I also want to point out that the rooms are not clean. Beds are comfortable, but bring your own sheets! The internet connection sucks! The in room safe is so small forget about bringing your laptop. The remote controls for the TV did not work. Finally when we did check out, I reminded front desk how bad it was, and she said thank you this will help us in th future!! I was so mad!! I called the hotel once we were home, not to cause a scene. I spoke with Renee, the night manager. What jerk. He said if it was such a problem he would have moved us to another room. There were no other rooms till the 3rd night!! He said with the toilets overflowing the last night, he could have moved us. That was at 2:30am!! We were checking out at 11am!! Would you want to pack, unpack and pack again??? After numerous messages & phone conversations, I learned no one at the GRAND cares about your stay. Terrence the GM, Renee the night manager, front desk. Stay anywhere but here, it was the worst out of hundreds of hotels I have stayed in. This is the Ist time I have cared to complain!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Grand Hotel the last week of September. This will definately be my hotel of choice when in Toronto (and i've stayed in many of Toronto's hotels). Spent several evenings in the rooftop whirlpools, enjoyed the oversized movie screen on the roof. The wireless internet was free and worked throughout the hotel. My room was spacious and modern - had ample room to work. The DVD player in the room was a nice touch and I was able to obtain films from the hotel gift shop. Used the fitness room (quite large) and pool every morning. Overall staff and service was quick and friendly and I would not hesitate to recommend the Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent a wonderful time at this hotel. The staff were excellent, food terrific and I thought the pool area and rooftop terrace were much better than the photographs I'd seen! Yes the rooms were smaller than they looked but were more than adequate..We enjoyed the hotel so much we returned for an extra two days. Very good value for money. As for the surrounding area, yes there were tramps (or pan handlers) asking for money but you encounter them in every city, and some of the area needing a face lift but it was only for two blocks. At least the tramps were polite and still said have a good day even when you didn't give them money. Anyway the free courtesy bus was available during the day and taxis were very cheap for those worried about walking in this part of town. The doormen were fanatastic! I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone. We will be returning the next time I visit Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooftop patio, and great for a family stay”
Reviews.Author: lzcrane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand last week with my three kids (teenagers). The price was about the best we could get for a hotel near the Eaton Centre area (which we were looking for), since we wanted a large area and enough sleeping space for the kids. We also wanted a separate bedroom for me and my husband. The Grand did not disappoint... All the negative stuff on this site about the area is just untrue. The area (Jarvis) was known to be a bad area (i.e. strip clubs -- and yes, there is one across the street behind the hotel and catecorner), but it's actually become a very simple and clean area. We felt extremely comfortable walking to and from the Eaton Centre area, and there's even a few good markets on Jarvis a few blocks down. (I walked down Yonge Street and felt way less safe...). Not so good points: The room was just okay. Kitchenette was great, bathroom was fine, beds were okay, but it wasn't anything special. Probably a step below a Marriott or Hyatt, but maybe closer to a Sheraton or just below. The restaurant/complimentary b'fast in the dining room was Terrific! We got a lot of value from that. It's a lovely room, too, with a piano bar at night. The pool (pictured on the site -- looks gorgeous) was nice, but so overheated and unvented in the room (a basement) that we couldn't bear to use it. Definitely a disappointment. However, the rooftop hot tubs are AMAZING. We would/will stay at this hotel again just for that experience. At night, the hotel screens music videos on the side of the adjacent building, and it's clear, beautiful, sounds great, and you see it with all of Toronto sparkling around you. There's a lot of lovely seating there as well, if you don't want to use the hot tubs. It's also a great rooftop area (with a covered gazebo) to sit and enjoy a newspaper at in the mornings or after using the gym. Check it out! Note: the hotel staff was fine and the rooms were not in disrepair -- ignore those other comments...

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as pictured...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in Toronto with my husband as a "getaway" and stayed at The Grand because of how unbelievable it looked in it's website pictures. Have stayed in many 4 star hotels across North America, and The Grand doesn't even compare. Rooms are rather small which was not a big deal- what bothered us more was the hotel seems very old and the rooms do not seem to be well kept. Comfortable bed, but the bathroom is tiny and seemed dingy, and dirty. The tv is TINY, and unless your on an upper floor, the views are nothing to brag about. Our bathrobes were missing from our room and we never received any. A nice touch having the mini fridge, microwave and newspaper in the morning. The pool is clean and nice - although it looks nothing like the one pictured online. The rooftop whirlpools and projection screen tv were great, as well as the complimentary breakfast buffet...but we wouldn't stay at The Grand the next time we are in Toronto, or would we recommend it to anyone. Other reviews have complained about the area The Grand is in- not an area I'd walk around alone in. Next time I'd pay the extra $50 or so to stay at a different hotel. One good point- very helpful and friendly staff at The Grand- no complaints there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the grand for a 3 day anniversary getaway. After reading a few negative posts we were a little worried. We had nothing to worry about. The staff were all very nice. The hotel gave us a lovely anniversary card when we checked in, and they wished us well. When we got to our room we didn't have any robes so we asked for them at the front desk. We had them delivered to our room within minutes. The housekeeping were very friendly and if they were near it they would push the elevator button when they saw us coming. The hotel itself was beautiful, we had a nice room facing the water. I read peoples compaints about the room size. The rooms were a fine size and people shouldn't be surprised because the hotel has the square footage for each room posted on the web site. Everything in the room worked fine. Anyone having trouble with the safe didn't read the instructions and the dvd and vcr worked fine too if you've ever used one before. The parking was fine for us and we drive a midsize car. In the undergroud I saw a few huge suv's and yes I'm not surprised those gas guzzlers don't fit, they were beasts. If you drive one of those you may have a bit of trouble. As far as the neighbourhood goes it is not as bad as everyone makes it seem. If you've never been to a big city I guess you might be a bit intimidated but my husband and I went out at night even and we had no trouble. Being within block of the Eaton centre is nice too because you can just walk. Yes a couple of street people asked us for change but if you can't handle that then I would suggest you just don't visit Toronto at all. The strip club people mentioned being next door I didn't even see until I was looking for it. This is because it is around back of the hotel, in the next block across the street. Not really as on top of the hotel as some may think. The food was wonderful and the continental breakfast has everything. We ate every meal on the patio, I suggest it to everyone because it is lovely. They play nice music and it has a nice atmosphere. The rooftop jaccuzzi was lovely as was the pool, we had both to ourselves most of the time. All in all we had a great time and I would go back and stay again. The people we met there were also having a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel during caribana weekend and i must say the pictures advertised on line where very mis leading the rooms were very very small, the parking garage was very small not equiped for suv's, parking on the premises outside the garage where bad because it was possible to get blocked in. the bathroom plumbing is in need of repair, light bulbs were out in the bathroom and the night stand lamp, the safe was diffulcult to operate was not wrking when we tried to use it the 1st time the dvd/vcr was diffilcult to operate had to have the maint. man come to our room about 7 times during our stay. The hotel looks nice the decor was very impressive but i will not be staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms in bad neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not much to say about this hotel other than the rooms are quite small, much smaller than I or my travel companion thought after looking on the website. The locations of the hotel is terrible, very scary people at all hours of the day. Beggers and vagrants crawling all over the place. Service okay, nothing special, facilities alright too. Didn't try the restaurant, didn't look too interesting. This place is not really as grand as the name would suggest.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Taffygirl
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel online because the photos were so impressive. Became a little nervous after reading some of these reviews! However the Grand Hotel was fabulous in every way. The staff were helpful and friendly and all areas of hotel were very clean. Great nightime views of downtown, spacious room. The pool and fitness room were better than any other hotel I have ever stayed in and very quiet during our stay. The roof top hot tubs were every bit as good as the photos.The breakfast buffet was superb and we enjoyed eating on the stunning patio area. The only slight negative is the location, bit of a walk to subway and probably wouldn't want to walk at night so we caught taxis, however this would not put me off staying here again. All in all a wonderful, luxurious hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: YvonneNorthenIreland
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a week at the Grand and I would recommend it to anyone. The room was spacious and very clean, the Citrus restaurant was of a high standard, the complimentary breakfast just right.Above all the staff were helpful and very courteous. When I read the other reviews I too was nervous about our stay but I need not have worried. OK the area is a little seedy but anyone living in a large city will not find it intimidating. If you do, the concierge will find you a taxi to use at night. Well done the Grand and thanks for a lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “Grand at the Grand”
Reviews.Author: egit
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Toronto for my husbands birthday.The Grand hit the mark it was excellent.The room was fine not as good as the web sight,but really fine,good bathroom ,comfortable bed,large kitchen area .The complimentary breakfast was first rate.Do try the restaurant food is very good,nice terrace.Where the grand excells is the roof top spa's they are wonderfull fantastic views morning or evening.The indoor pool and gym are also excellent.We read that the area was dodgy,but we had our 10 year old with us and had no problems,no hastles.Very convienient for the subway.I would go back tomorrow.Try it

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel - Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: angelika0368
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a two bedroom suite for a weekend with some friends of ours. When we checked in they asked to charge our card before we even went up to the room. (This is highly irregular since most hotels charge at check-out) When we got to the room we discovered that it was just a room. One room with one bed. We went back to the front desk, sure that this was a mistake and we were told that this was a "different configuration of the same rate." We told them that we did not plan on staying in this room (four people- one bed) and checked out. It has been two weeks and about twenty calls to the manager and we still have not been refunded. Not only did we have to try to find two rooms or a two bedroom suite at 7pm on a friday, making international calls while our cell phones were roaming but now the manager is just messing us around. The hotel is nice. We have stayed here before but the management holds absolutely no regard for customer satisfaction. The last time we stayed my friend cut off the tip of her toe on their jacuzzi filter and some of our items were stolen in the jacuzzi area by a bunch of drunk teenagers and the manager offered no compensation. Not even an apology. I would go back to the grand if it were purchased by a major hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Phenominal!”
Reviews.Author: KAWS
Reviews.Content: My husband gave me a weekend here with my two best friends for a "significant" birthday. What a treat! The suites were big enough that we all got our own little nook to sleep in. Since it was my birthday, they let me have the huge, comfy bed. My friends did say that the pull out couches could have been a little more comfortable but that was our only complaint. The service at this place was superb. We had dinner at the Citrus one night and the food and presentation was wonderful. Complimentary breakfast each morning was very well done. Lots to choose from and tons of fresh food. We had spa direct come and do massages for us in our room! How cool was that? The spa staff were very professional and did a great job. Afterwards we went and enjoyed the roof top hot tubs and then the pool. The pictures on the site are EXACTLY what you will get. We had a wonderful time. From the people that greeted us at the front door, to the front desk staff, to room service to even the maintenance staff (we locked outselves out of our room safe) the service was impeccable and quick. The place is (to me) a tad pricey but a very nice retreat. I give this four stars because of the pull out couches and the fact that it was so pricey but all in all, I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Grand time at the Grand”
Reviews.Author: Richard777
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a stay... I have now stayed at this hotel numerous times and I will tell you, I have never been so taken care of in my life. Fantastic, upbeat restaurant staff combined with sincere, hard working, friendly, not to mention very good looking hotel staff. Rooftop hot tubs, you can't go wrong! The hotel management is top of the line. Citrus Restaurant This place is like no other hotel restaurant I have been in. It's like actually eating at a really nice restaurant, not just the regular same ol' hotel garbage. Great value for your dollar. My girl had the rack of lamb, and she was smiling all night long. Try the cheeseburger and then ask them what its made from. The Front Desk It's nice to walk into a hotel and with a warm, friendly greeting. Not to mention how good looking the ladies are. These wonderful ladies at the desk took great care of me. Upgrading my room has never been an issue. The Room Great space for your dollar. Comfy bed, and a fully equip bathroom, could you ask for anything more? Yes! and you can have it at The Grand. Beautiful suites with balconies, hot tubs, and fully functional kitchens. Want more? Of course, just ask, and you will receive. The pool Swimmable. The laundry room Usable. Want a late checkout? try asking! The staff Great, even better at the restaurant. The internet The Grand is equipped. Come to Toronto, enjoy the Grand.

Reviews.Title: “loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a one week stay at the Grand Hotel and our stay was exceptional. Loved the view from the hot tubs on the roof. Great staff at citrus restaurant made us feel at home, breakfast buffet was exceptional. My children loved the pool. Will stay again on our next trip to Toronto this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Grand for 7 days and we had a great time. There's a little bit of truth in most all the negative reviews, but overall the price and amenities outwiegh the negatives. Upon check in we were upgraded to an executive suite which gave our 3year old and 7year old separate pull-out couches to sleep on. The pool and hot tubs inside were lovely, but the hot tubs on the roof were tepid and unusable in the snow. The exercise room had a sauna and a hot tub as well as perfectly adequate exercise eqipment. Service was great, we used the shuttle twice, the front desk was very helpful, and maintenence found us a humidifier and got it going upon request. Breakfast was extensive, if not top notch and Starbucks coffee was served. The kids were thrilled to find fruit loops and bacon and I found fresh fruit and yogurt. Yes the rooms were small, yes the carpet and furniture were tatty, yes the area was scruffy but a good time was had by all.

Reviews.Title: “No Manager?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On my last stay at this hotel, I had experienced some major billing problems on my last receipt. So major that I wanted to speak to the manager to get is resolved. When I asked the front desk to speak with him or her, I was told they weren't available. I asked when they would be, and was told there wasn't going to be one this weekend... how is that possible? What if there was an emergency? I am not going to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved the Grand, charming hotel. Front desk staff was very friendly, stayed in a Grand deluxe room which was quite spacious. Really enjoyed the pool, free Wireless internet, free movies, hot tubs and breakfast. I recommend The Grand to all.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: -Elevators are slow -Rooms are on the small side -We found the rooms very noisey -Price is a little on the high side for what you get -Service really not there, lacking in all areas. The one thing my wife and I did enjoy was the restaurant Citrus. Very nice atmosphere, service was good andt he food too. Unless you've managed to stay in the restaurant, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather sleep in my car”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel at the beginning of January. Rooms were not as advertised on the website. They were small, sheets were paper thin, there was hair ALL OVER the bathroom and worst of all, the staff were unfriendly. It's a personal pet peve of mine when service workers chat amongst themselves when a customer needs help, and I waited at least 1 minute or maybe even 2 for the two receptionists to finish their conversation and check me in. The door men weren't always there, and useless at flagging a taxi. At check-out, our rate was $50.00 than what we were quoted and I had to argue with the desk to fix the problem. All in all, I will never return here until this place falls under new management.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst, not the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel on numerous occaisions, and to sum it up, it's not great but it's not terrible either. It used to be the preferred hotel for my company, and consequently I found myself here often. Service wasn't great but the rooms are nice enough. I also found it ironic that the reviewer from Port Huron made a point of mentioning the size of Batavia, New York as Port Huron Michigan is of no signifance either. I know myself I have submitted many reviews at once for different hotels as I have visited Toronto many times on business, before the creation of this website. I think the Port Huron reviewer's harsh criticism of the reviewer from Batavia suggests he/she is affiliated to the Grand in some way other than just a customer. I imagine the reviewer from Batavia simply did the same as I, discovered this interactive website, and wanted to share as many hotel experiences as possible. All in all, this website is a terrific idea, and I hope it continues to grow. Let each hotel's management respond to reviewer complaints and don't take it into your hands, this is why TripAdvisor afford hotel's this option. The Grand hotel has nice rooms, and poor service, that's what it comes down to.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Grand about it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited the Grand Hotel over New Years Eve weekend. We were expecting suite sized rooms with above average service. The staff was OK while the surroundings were very over rated. We needed to change rooms because of shredded, tattered and broken furniture. The rooms were no bigger than an average budget hotel and poorly designed. Every aspect of the design and decor is budget. This is NOT a suite hotel. We visited the rooftop hot tub at 3 PM in the afternoon to see if it would be a place to visit in the evening. While the setting could have been interesting the decks were cluttered with dirty towels,cigarette butts and empty beer cans from the night before. The breakfast buffet made the situation tolerable and the only reason we we did not change hotels. The "grandest" aspect of this hotel is the lighting from the street. As soon as you enter it is a major disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “previous reviewer from Batavia is full of baloney, probably a liar too”
Reviews.Author: cherylstar
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed at this hotel, but am going back to Toronto in May and have been looking at numerous Trip Advisor reviews of various hotels to decide where to stay. I have seen at least 3 reviews of different Toronto hotels from reviewer(s) in Batavia, NY (all dated 12/25) that are extremely negative. I did a search on Batavia and saw that the population in 1990 was 16,000. So the local populace either travels a lot and also uses Trip Advisor (on the same date) to air their complaints, or someone in Batavia has a relative that owns/manages a hotel in Toronto that must have a glowing review from Batavia and wants to slam all the other highly-rated hotels. I stayed near the area of the Grand Hotel (Novetel, didn't care for it) in November and have no complaints about the location. I did a lot of walking and never felt in jeopardy (or unsafe at all, for that matter) and I'm female. So take the review of the Batavia person with a grain (or several) of salt. If I had the time (or the inclination) I'd search, find and list all the hotels this so-called reviewer managed to supposedly stay at during the same period of time and go to each hotel's Trip Advisor review to up their rating.

Reviews.Title: “The Gem in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: WillinWC
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel & Suites in Toronto is by far my favorite hotel I've ever stayed in. I've travelled around the world and stayed in many nice hotels in Europe and across the US, and this hotel is tops! It's the type of hotel that makes you want to come back to Toronto each year so you can enjoy all that the hotel has to offer. For me, there's two types of hotels you can stay in. There's the type where the staff and owners don't go to great lengths to keep their guests comfortable..they're there to do their jobs, and meanwhile the property inevitably gets run down and before you know it it's a disaster. Then there's the hotel where the staff takes complete pride in their hotel. They go out of their way to make each guest comfortable and happy, and keep everything at the property in perfect condition, and everything always seems new and spotlessly clean. If you want the best of the latter, you have to give the Grand a try. Everything about this hotel seems luxurious. From the spectacular setting of the indoor pool to the amazing rooftop terrace with large jacuzzis and unbeatable panoramic views of the city and lake (and even Niagara Falls on a clear day) to the beautifully designed guestrooms, it's all top notch. Not to mention the FREE breakfast buffet in the classic restaurant adjacent to the main lobby. It's not your typical hotel continental breakfast buffet, this has everything from pastries, fruit, sausage, eggs, biscuits, juices, french toast etc. and it's all delicious. Guest rooms range in size from smaller than average to huge apartment-size suites. We stayed in one of the smallest suites, and although it was on the smaller side, the comfortable beds (understatement) and views, along with the marble bathrooms and complimentary bathrobes more than made up for the fact it wasn't the largest room ever. It made for a very cozy and comfortable experience. This coming from someone who loves large spacious hotel rooms. I'd rather stay at the Grand than somewhere that offers huge rooms. The location is great because it provides for unbeatable views, and right on the corner (Dundas and Jarvis), you can catch one of the red Toronto streetcars that'll take you a couple blocks away to the Eaton Center and trains. Overall, you really can't beat this hotel. It's the reason I go to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Grand View”
Reviews.Author: getawaygal
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay in a Grand Deluxe room - 1 king bed. Asked for a "special room" at check-in as we were celebrating a major birthday and we got room 1804 - on the top floor with a view of the water - really spectacular! We could also see the CN Tower and many other landmark buildings.
