Layout of the room was interesting - upon entering there is a small "lounge area" with a sofa bed, coffee table and TV, in the middle of the space is the kitchenette area (complete with ice cubes in the freezer) and the bathroom, and finally the bed area with another TV and desk. It wasn't the largest room but we didn't feel cramped and the furnishings were quite nice. The breakfast buffet was good as others have noted, as was the pool area - the sauna was great this time of year! The free shuttle does not run on the weekend but hotel is within walking distance of a lot of the main attractions - we didn't find the neighborhood to be scary as some have noted. All staff were pleasant, the room (and rest of the hotel) was clean but it was a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice when visiting in the summer”
Reviews.Author: LTJ874
Reviews.Content: I spent a few nights at the Grand in September. Firstly, it is true that the area immediately surrounding the hotel is not the best in Toronto, but you are only a couple of blocks away from the main square in Toronto, and at no time did I feel unsafe. I stayed in a junior suite which was clean and spacious. Check-in was very efficient. However, there were a couple of things in the room, such as peeling paint by the window, and a faulty bathroom light and I would have expected a hotel of this type to have identified and dealt with this promptly. That said, there were also some nice touches: every evening a card would be posted under your door with a weather forecast for the following day. The hotel also has a well-equipped and spacious gym - something of rariety in hotels. This hotel is particularly good choice when visiting Toronto in the summer. The hotel has a roof terrace with hot-tobs and great views of the city. There is also an outdoor terrace on the ground floor and breakfast on the terrace was a great way to the start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved it. the hotel was lovely, the location was good, the staff were very helpful, the free breakfast included a great range of food, the pool was quiet and well maintained, the hot tub on the roof gave you lovely views of toronto. would definately stay here again, very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one week in this really nice hotel returning on 22nd October 2004. The room was very spacious with a fridge cooker microwave etc, and we had a lovely view of the CN tower and the city. The indoor pool was lovely with a sauna in the changing room. In the gym changing room there was a steam room, sauna and jacuzzi pool. On the rooftop they had Californian hot tubs with a magnificent view of the city. Although it was cold outside the tubs were lovely and hot. The complimentary breakfast had a good choice although it was repetetive throughout the week but this would not deter us from using the hotel again. We decided to travel to and from the airport on the Express Shuttle Bus service and it stopped on Bond Street only 3 blocks from the Grand Hotel. Although the area was a wee bit seedy it did not bother us. The location of the hotel was good as it was only a short distance from the Eaton Centre. We are going to use this hotel again and would recomend it to friends. We felt the hotel was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not that scary!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Grand with my young son and found it ok. It has its good and bad points, but for the money it was worth it. As for the neighbourhood, its not that bad. There are a lot of homeless people going about, but they are not threatening. Indeed coming back from an event at the Skydome, I saw more homeless people sleeping on Yonge Street, in the 'good' part of town. So, if your a bit worldly you should be able to cope with the area ok, but if your not then stay at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Ma & Pop Operation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels I have stayed in in Toronto. The staff are incredibly rude, there is no management on duty in the event something goes wrong and for the price, the rooms aren't that spectacular. The neighbourhood is also incredibly scary and makes you feel uncomfrotable! Avoid this hotel, it is incredibly amateur!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bassgirl2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and another couple were in Toronto this September for the Film Festival, and I chose the Grand Hotel based on reviews I read online. We were more than happy with the hotel. It was beautiful, very clean and comfortable, with a fantastic rooftop sunning area. The brunch on the terrace restaurant in the morning was delightful (pick a table closer to the fountain, though, rather than by the street which is noisy). Our rooms (junior suites) were spacious and the beds extremely comfy. My sister-in-law had a massage and facial in the spa, which she said was great. The gym was very nicely equipped. As far as the area the hotel is in, which a few of the reviews mentioned, it's really not bad at all. I would highly recommend the Grand Hotel to anyone, and plan on staying there again on our next visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff at the Grand”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel and its amenities are nice. However it doesn't matter how great the amenities are if the staff are rude and obnoxious. That's exactly what we got. The night clerk at the Grand was extremely rude and impatient and lacked the tact to speak to paying patrons. There was no management present to escalate the issues to. The staff communicated that no management is present during the weekends. How riducolous is that? I've stayed at many hotels in the Toronto area and there is always management present to escalate or discuss issues with. We will never stay at this hotel again.
